loans.name: Yolima Patricia

texts.es: Yolima tiene 41 años, inicio su negocio hace dos años convencida de que para lograr el éxito solo se requería dedicación, perseverancia y deseos de crecer,  siendo madre de tres hijas y a la vez esposa maneja un negocio de cacharrería desde su casa donde vende artículos para el hogar, accesorios, productos de tocador, útiles de papelería y demás productos que le solicitan sus clientes, especialmente familiares amigos y vecinos. La recompensa por su devoción no se hizo esperar, sus resultados fueron sorprendentes y logró adquirir dos vitrinas para exhibir su mercancía. Ahora está aplicando a su primer CrediKiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el que planea incrementar su inventario y  diversificar más sus productos; accesorios para el hogar, papelería y productos de belleza. Esta inversión es necesaria para  aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias que en el futuro le permitan alcanzar su sueño de acondicionar un local comercial en su casa y apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos familiares y brindar una buena educación para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Yolima is 41 years old.  She started her business two years ago convinced that with dedication, perseverance, and desire for growth she would be successful.  In addition to being a mother of 3 daughters and a wife, she also manages a convenience store from her house where she sells home articles, accessories, toiletries, stationery, and other products her clients request, especially her family, friends and neighbors.  The reward for her dedication quickly paid off as her results were surprisingly positive and she as able to obtain two storefront windows to exhibit her merchandise.  
She's now applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase and diversify her inventory, including home products, stationery, and beauty products.  This investment is needed to increase her sales and profits so that in the future she's able to attain her dream to prepare a commercial space in her house and support her husband with the family expenses and give a good education to her daughters.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her inventory, including home products, stationery, and beauty products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old and has four children. Isabel is married and three of her children are in school.

Isabel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Isabel has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Isabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the restaurant and create more space

loans.name: Lolo  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  3 membres du groupe  LOLO 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BINKO, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MINATA, au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The three members of the Lolo 3 Group are married women. On average, each member is 30 years old and has on average three children. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Binko, one of the villages of Baya, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can continue their agricultural activities during the winter season. This will be their fifth group loan.

Minta (the woman standing in the middle of the photo) grows peanuts. With this loan, she plans on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, her produce will then be sold at market to a customer base made up of both retailers and consumers. Haby plans to make an average profit of 75,000 FCFA per season. These profits will allow her to pay back the loan and assist her husband with their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, farming inputs and seeds

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a single woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 36 years old and three of her children are presently in school.

Riza has a buy and sell of used clothes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, underwear and other used clothes to sell.

Riza has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses, underwear and other used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married with five children and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 17 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 45 years old and has four children. Perlita is married and all of her children are in school.

Perlita is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Perlita has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mana

texts.en: Mana is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her sister, her brother and her parents. Her family owns one hectare of rice fields and one pig. In May 2014, she left her work in the fields and decided to be trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Mana now makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for the animal food. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. For almost 10 years she has been doing a business in agriculture. She is well known among agrarians and friends. Each gained harvest she sells at a domestic market. She is planning to process and fertilize her land. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds to prepare her land and have a good harvest next season. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds to prepare her land and have a good harvest next season

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 58 years old, married and has three children. She has been a hog raiser and a vegetable vendor for about 10 years. She wanted to continue nourishing her hogs but has insufficient funds to sustain them. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustenance. She hopes to dispose of her hogs at a higher cost and will revolve her income in the vegetable vending business as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines to sustain her hogs

loans.name: Mariyamhan

texts.ru: Мариямхан, 58 лет, вдова, есть 7 детей. У Мариямхан- среднее образование, она на пенсии, занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Мариямхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS), также получает ежемесячно пенсию. Однако, данных средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Мариямхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят развить ее бизнес, увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Mariyamhan is 58 years old, widowed, and has 7 children. Mariyamhan has a secondary education, is retired, and works on a farm, providing an income for her family. Thanks to Mariyamhan's tireless hard work, today she has 2 cows on her farm. The monthly profit from the business is around 8,000 som (KGS), and in addition she receives a monthly pension.  However, this is not enough for a dignified life, or to support her family. Mariyamhan turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle. Income from the loan will allow her to develop her business, increase profit and improve her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy some livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es: José Fernando es un docente de 52 años, que por su condición de desempleado y la situación económica se dedica a la venta de productos químicos puerta a puerta y en las tiendas de diversos municipios de la Costa Caribe Colombiana. Su historia inició en su juventud cuando trabajó para un ingeniero químico que le enseño a preparar insecticidas y plaguicidas, posteriormente logró trabajar en su profesión de docente pero paralelamente ejecutaba su actividad para conservar el negocio al que actualmente se dedica de tiempo completo. El planea invertir los recursos del CrediKiva que tramitó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en incrementar su inventario de mercancías al comprar insecticidas y plaguicidas, pues con esto le permitirá ampliar  su cobertura en otros municipios de la Costa Caribe Colombiana a los que no atiende por falta de capacidad. José Fernando planea que con el incremento en las ventas sus utilidades mejorarán y le permitirá atender los costos de la educación de sus 4 hijos a los que aspira a convertir en profesionales.
texts.en:
Jose Fernando is a 52 year old unemployed teacher who because of his financial situation now sells chemical products door to door and in several stores in the municipalities of the Caribbean coast of Colombia.   In his youth he worked for a chemical engineer who taught him how to make insecticides and pesticides.  He then started working as a teacher but he still worked on his chemical business in parallel to keep it active and now he works full time at it.  
He plans to invest the resources obtained through the Kiva loan and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in increasing his product stock by buying insecticides and pesticides.  This will allow him to extend his business coverage to other municipalities in the Caribbean coast of Colombia where he doesn't currently work because he lacks the resources.
Jose Fernando plans to increase his income which will help him cover the education costs of his 4 children which he hopes become future professionals.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Жылдыз имеет в хозяйстве 6 коров, 33 овец. На земельном участке мерою 4,32 Га собственной земли она выращивает органическую люцерну, вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 7,000 сом (KGS). Жылдыз вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян ячменя, люцерны и топлива для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhyldyz has successfully repaid her loan, using it for its intended purpose. She thanks the Kiva Foundation and everyone who helped her with financing the loan. Thanks to her tireless hard work, today Zhyldyz has 6 cows and 33 sheep on her farm. She has her own area of land measuring 4.32 hectares, where she grows organic alfalfa, and all of these together bring a monthly profit of around 7,000 som (KGS). Zhyldyz has again turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy barley and alfalfa seeds, and fuel for land cultivation. With income from the loan, Zhyldyz plans to invest in the further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds of barley and alfalfa, as well as fuel for land cultivation and growing organic products.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alicia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  venta de crianza de animales menores, la socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC.  The bank is located in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  Alicia alternates her daily activities with raising and selling small animals.  The partner is very grateful for receiving the loan and is committed to pay the monthly quotas.   
She's a responsible and dedicated woman.  She raises the animals to later sell them to the clients that request them.  She's able to maintain her family through this activity.  She requests the loan to buy animals and food for them.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them.

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru:
Юсуфчону 41 лет. Он вместе женой и детьми проживает на районе Кубадиен. Он занимается земледелием больше 2 лет. Для него данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода. Онаъ каждый сезон вместе с женой сажают урожай. Работать на земле тяжело, но Юсуфчон несмотря ни на что двигается только вперед. Главный человек в его жизни дети и жена, ради них он живет и работает. 
  Юсуфчон имеет участок земли, где осуществят посев урожая. Он посадил картофель и сейчас собирает с радостью. Он просит кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки землю для нового посева урожай.
texts.en: Yusufjon is 41 years old. He lives in the area of Qubadiyon together with his wife and children. He has been working in arable farming for more than two years. At the moment, this is his only source of income. Every season, he sows the harvest with his wife. Working on the land is hard, but in spite of this Yusufjon is only moving forwards. The most important people in his life are his wife and children, and it is for their sake that he lives and works. Yusufjon has a plot of land, where he sows his crops. He planted potatoes and is now harvesting them with joy. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for tilling the land when sowing new harvests.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Jose es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is from the countryside, humble and a hard-worker with the drive and will which distinguishes rural men and women. 

He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind and since he was very young he learned all of the jobs of the countryside such as cultivation and raising animals, so that today he has his own coffee crops. 

This person has as his goal to increase his crops and improve the ones he currently has, and for this he comes for the help of a loan from Corporación Interactuar for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and coffee seeds. 

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as a businessman and as a person, in addition to increasing his income and continuing to provide the sustenance to his household.

The only thing he wants is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure and coffee seeds.

loans.name: Mirna Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirna, una mujer de 50 años, vive en el municipio de Cerete, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Esta mujer de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Mirna podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, algunas adecuaciones locativas y en la compra de surtido e ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Colabora a una mujer emprendedora, de mente creativa y grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Mirna is a 50 year old woman who lives in the municipality of Cerete, a small city where the opportunities to get ahead are limited and the business competition is strong.  This entrepreneurial woman with strong wishes to get ahead has a project to start a food business.  
With the help from the loan, Mirna will make her dream come true by being independent and generating her own income to cover the home expenses.  The money will be invested in buying tables and chairs as well as adapting the business space and buying ingredients and materials for preparing the food.  Collaborate with an entrepreneurial woman with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as adapting the business space and buying ingredients and materials for preparing the food.

loans.name: Donaldo

texts.es:
Donaldo, un padre de 34 años de edad con 3 hijos a su cuidado, es responsable de hogar y ha podido sostener a su numerosa familia gracias a que trabaja como productor agropecuario en distintas fincas. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría con pollos los cuales criara y alimentara, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír. 

Apoyen a este empresario que quiere demostrar que es capaz de salir adelante humildemente.
texts.en:
Donaldo a 34-year-old father with 3 children in his care, is responsible for his household and has been able to support his large family thanks to his work as a laborer in various farms.

He asks for a loan to undertake his own business, a small enterprise which he would begin with chickens which he will raise and feed. He took the initiative basically for his children because he wants to enjoy a better life with them, that they go to school and that every day they have a reason to smile. 

Support this businessman who whats to show he is capable of getting ahead humbly.

loans.use: to begin a business raising chickens.

loans.name: Ana Regina

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Ana desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en el municipio de Montería.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le da su familia que la impulsan para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, nevera, 1 carrito de comidas con freidora, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the vision of getting ahead and improving herself, Ana wants to open a fast food business in the municipality of Montería.

This idea arose from the motivation that her family gives her which pushed her to open this business and in this way generate the necessary income to sustain her household. Although she has always wanted to be independent, she has never had the courage to risk herself to undertake a business. But now she feels she has the strength and ability to do it. 

She asks for a loan to purchase everything necessary to open her business such as a freezer, a refrigerator, a food cart with a fryer, supplies and ingredients to prepare food. 

With these things, she will be able to begin this project and will realize her dream of being independent.

With the support of this loan, you will be boosting the enterprising ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a refrigerator, a food cart with a fryer, and supplies and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Ana Isable

texts.es:
Ana en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según ella le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Lorica, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por sus 5 hijos y su esposo.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de una Colombiana con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Ana, in her search for a promising future and good opportunities to get ahead, decided to undertake a business that, according to her, will give her everything that she has always dreamed of.

She will open a grocery store business in her house in the municipality of Lorica, with which she plans to support her family comprised of her 5 children and her husband. 

Her primary difficulty is the lack of working capital.

To achieve this, she needs the help of a loan from Corporación Interactuar what will permit her to purchase a cooler, shelving, a display case, and an assortment of basic pantry products such as groceries, grains, cookies and other foods to stock and begin her business.  

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Colombian woman with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase a cooler, shelving, a display case, and an assortment of groceries, grains, cookies, and other foods to stock and begin her business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo, 35, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, the Philippines. He is newly married to Nilda, who is also a baker. The couple works hard to provide for their everyday needs and to prepare for their future family. 

Wilfredo has been operating his bakery for one year already. Local bakeries are a familiar sight in many of his town's neighborhoods, offering freshly made breads, cakes, and rolls. Hot "pandesal" (hot round bread), "ensaymada" (a light, fluffy bread spread with butter on top and sprinkled with sugar and cheese), "monay" (a yellow bread that can be made into different shapes and can either be hard and chewy or soft and fluffy) are a common part of the breakfast and snack foods of Filipinos. 

Wilfredo earns a minimum of 700 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day. His regular customers are his neighbors and his local community. To help him continue with his business, he would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan through CCT and Kiva, which he will use to buy more of the ingredients needed for his bakery. He thanks God and you for your good heart and the financial help as it will surely allow the couple to cover their daily needs.

Wilfredo hopes to serve more customers. He aims to own a house and land with his wife and future kids. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members at CCT to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients  for his bakery

loans.name: Andrea Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sosote es una parroquia del cantón Rocafuerte  que se dedica directamente al arte de elaboración de objetos con tagua, tras un extenso proceso de pulido y pintado dan vida a más de 10 mil figuras,  también ofrece la muy solicitada longaniza o salchicha de vísceras de cerdo, estas se veden fritas o como sopa, toda esa delicia se prepara en las ollas de barro típicas de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señorita  Andrea, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y  vive con su mamá y un hermano que estudia en el colegio. No tienen casa propia.
Doña Andrea es una muy  buena hija que trata de ayudarle a su mamá con la dura carga del hogar,  ella realiza los créditos para que su mamá  utilice en su trabajo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende comida típica de la zona (secos de gallinas criollas, caldos, almuerzos, etc.) Atiende cuatro días a la semana (jueves, viernes, sábados, domingo y días feriados) el horario de atención es de ocho horas diarias o hasta que se acabe la comida preparada.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar utensilios de cocina y víveres. Lleva un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la unidad del grupo y el seguro médico. Su sueño es estudiar en la universidad la carrera de marketing.
texts.en:
Sosote is a parish in the canton of Rocafuerte known especially for art and handicrafts made from ivory-nut palm trees.  After an involved process of polishing and painting, they give life to more than ten thousand figures.  They are also known for their pork sausages which are sold in soups or fried.  All this exquisite food is prepared in the traditional clay pots from the region.  This is where Andrea lives.
Andrea is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mom and a brother who attends school.  They don't own their home.  Andrea is a very good daughter that tries to help her mom with the home responsibilites.  She requests the loans for her mom's business.  She has a small restaurant where she sells traiditional regional dishes (chicken dishes, soups, lunches, etc.)  She works 4 days a week (Thursday - Sunday and Holidays) for 8 hours a day or until the day's food is finished.  
She will use this loan to buy kitchen utensils and foodstuffs.  She's been in the Credit Group for one year and she likes the unity in the group and the health insurance.  Her dreams is to obtain a college degree in marketing.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Sreynoeun

texts.en: Sreynoeun is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the north-west of Cambodia. She is 21 years old and lives in a wooden pile house with her parents, one brother and three sisters. Her family owns four hectares of rice fields, a hectare of cassava and two pigs. In May 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sreynoeun now makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer for the fields. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to buy silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to pay for silk, dyeing and loom preparation

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Padre de 3 hijos y con un gran deseo verlos convertidos en todos unos profesionales es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo al señor Ramiro de 51 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira que con este humilde empleo brindarles una educación universitaria a todos sus hijos ya que no quiere verlos en un corral realizando estas funciones.

Ya que su deseo es poder brindarles una mejor vida a todos sus hijos necesita de una actividad capaz de generar los recursos suficientes para cubrir estos gastos y sin descuidar los gastos primordiales del hogar.

Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos los cuales criara y engordara para su posterior venta. 

Ramiro está muy motivado con este gran proyecto ya que sus hijos demuestran buenas actitudes estudiantiles y disposición para triunfar y hacer que sus padres se sientan más que orgulloso de sus hijos.

Impacta la vida de Ramiro con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Ramiro, aged 51, has 3 children whom he very much hopes will grow up to become working professionals. Ramiro works enthusiastically and tirelessly on his pig farm, a humble job, and aspires to provide a university education for his children, as he doesn't want them to work on the farm. 

As his goal is to provide a better quality of life for his children, he needs a job which will provide sufficient income for covering these costs as well as basic household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs to raise and fatten for sale.

Ramiro is very motivated by this important project because his children are doing well at school, and have the potential to succeed and make their parents even more proud of them.

Make an impact on Ramiro's life with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and fatten for sale.

loans.name: Leicy Guadelia

texts.es:
Sosote es una parroquia del cantón Rocafuerte  que se dedica directamente al arte de elaboración de objetos con tagua, tras un extenso proceso de pulido y pintado dan vida a más de 10 mil figuras,  también ofrece la muy solicitada longaniza o salchicha de vísceras de cerdo, estas se veden fritas o como sopa, toda esa delicia se prepara en las ollas de barro típicas de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señorita Leicy,  tiene 27  años de edad, es soltera y vive con los padres en casa propia.
Doña Leicy trabaja de profesora en una institución privada. Como buena hija trata de ayudarle a su mamá con los gastos del hogar, ella realiza los créditos para que su mamá lo utilice en su trabajo, hace 27 años su mamá instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Además también vende productos de belleza al mismo  tiempo que realiza sus otros trabajos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, cepillos, secadoras, entre otros. Lleva  seis meses en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y los beneficios que recibe de la fundación como el seguro de salud. Su sueño es tener salud, una casa y un carro propio.
texts.en:
Sosote is a parish in the canton of Rocafuerte known especially for art and handicrafts made from ivory-nut palm trees. After an involved process of polishing and painting, they give life to more than ten thousand figures. They are also known for their pork sausages which are sold in soups or fried. All this exquisite food is prepared in the traditional clay pots from the region. This is where Leicy lives.
Leicy is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in their own home.  She works as a professor at a private institution.  She's a good daughter who tries to help her mother with the home expenses.  She requests the loans for her her mother's business.  
Twenty seven years ago her mother set up a beauty parlor in her house in which she provides different services like hair dying, hair cuts, nail painting, among other services.  She works from 8AM to 8PM or even later if her clients require her services.  She also sells beauty products.  
She will use the loan to buy hair dyes, hair brushes, hair dryers, among other products.  She's been in the credit group for 6 months and she likes it because of the unity of the group and other benefits from the foundation, like the health insurance.  Her dream is to be in good health and one day have her own car and house.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, hair brushes, hair dryers, among other products.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Crisanta requested a 11,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the number of soap and detergent products in her shop.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a vegetable and fruit selling business.

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane lives at Solana with her family. She is raising hogs for income. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells vegetable to the people in her village. Mary Jane hopes to increase her profits so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines peso (PHP) to buy feed for hogs and to buy vegetables to sell. Someday, she hopes to increase her profits to be able to save for her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to expand his farming activity so as to increase production.

loans.name: Narcisa Jaqueline

texts.es:
Sosote es una parroquia del cantón Rocafuerte que se dedica directamente al arte de elaboración de objetos con tagua, tras un extenso proceso de pulido y pintado dan vida a más de 10 mil figuras,  también ofrece la muy solicitada longaniza o salchicha de vísceras de cerdo, estas se veden fritas o como sopa, toda esa delicia se prepara en las ollas de barro típicas de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, dos son mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 17  años que estudia en el colegio. El cónyuge es maestro artesano en un taller de aluminio y cerrajería. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Narcisa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana  tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos y ropa. Esta en el Grupo De Crédito hace un año y le gusta por la responsabilidad del grupo en todo momento, los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos como siempre lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en:
Sosote is a parish in the canton of Rocafuerte known especially for art and handicrafts made from ivory-nut palm trees. After an involved process of polishing and painting, they give life to more than ten thousand figures. They are also known for their pork sausages which are sold in soups or fried. All this exquisite food is prepared in the traditional clay pots from the region. This is where Nracisa lives.  
Narcisa is 44 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 3 sons.  Two of them are adults and independent and one is 17 years old and attends school.  Her husband is a master craftsman. They live in their own home.  
Narcisa is a housewife and to obtain her own resources and help her husband with the home expenses she sells all clothes variety and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women accesories).  She works 3-4 days a a week for 3 hours a day.  She sells her products on credit and collects payment every 8 days.  She's been carrying out with this business for 6 years and it's been going very well.  The articles she sells the most are the cosmetics and perfumes.  
This loan is to buy cosmetics and clothes.  She's been in the Credit Group for a year and she likes it because of the responsibility of the group and the ease of payment.  Her dream is to continue supporting her kids.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 35 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fely has a general store business (sari-sari store) in the Philippines. Fely requested a 14,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Fely has been in this business for five years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Selina operates a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan, she wants to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.en:
Husniya is a kind woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a remote small town with her family. She is married and has three children. 

Since 2012 she has been busy in agriculture. She plants agricultural products like wheat and cereals on her land. Additionally she keeps livestock at home and grows them in order to sell in the domestic market. 

She needs money to prepare her land for the next season. She appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a help to get a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals. She hopes she will get a good harvest in the next season. She awaits your kindness; it would help her to have income to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Milda

texts.en:
Milda, 46, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Milda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Milda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

In the future, Milda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Naïve

texts.en:
Naïve is 44 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She farms vegetable on the island of Bohol in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Naïve has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her business to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ailie

texts.en:
Ailie, 32, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ailie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Ailie requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Ailie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Nelgie

texts.en:
Nelgie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nelgie dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is a widowed woman who has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She and her children live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over eight years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is 40 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has had a food vending business on Bohol in the Philippines for 10 years and has requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 40-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband in a small simple house. Bayan and her husband have a grocery store in the village where they sell basic grocery products and kids' candy. It is a good business and provides them with a good income.

Bayan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her grocery store. This will increase her sales and also her income. Bayan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina 23 years old, married to Walter and supports a family of 2 members.

She has been in a retail business for the last 2 years earning KES 6,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more bars of soap, washing powder, bread, flour, milk and other retail household goods.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan as well as stabilize her business.

Her future hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more bars of soap, washing powder, bread, flour, milk and other retail household goods

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 41 years old, married and blessed with nine children. 

He has a motorcycle transport business. He will be using the loan to buy spare parts and start a motorcycle spare parts sales business in hopes this will enable him to supply spare parts to motorcycle mechanics in the area. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to buy more spare parts and be successful in his business.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle spare parts sales shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, washing soap, sugar and other items. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 52 years old, married with nine children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pig and E-loading.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices and personal care products

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosana is 28 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rosana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosana has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 61 years old and has ten children. Basilisa is a married woman.

Basilisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Basilisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Basilisa has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Basilisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a 47-year old woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Candida has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Candida has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Candida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married with two children one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married mother  and has three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join yehu to access loan facilities to boost business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman and has been blessed with four children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Edibe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde el año 2010 la señora Edibe encontró la fórmula para sentirse útil y poder generar sus propios ingresos y lo logro gracias a la venta de pan y pasteles.

Edibe es una responsable, trabajadora y servicial mujer de 44 años de edad que se enorgullece de no tener que pedir dinero a nadie pues ella misma se consigue sustento. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar pan al por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas, este es un negocio poco común en su barrio y es por eso que le dedica de 6 a 8 horas a su negocio.

Con tu ayuda Edibe podrá mejorar su capital y tener un mejor sustento, apoya hoy!
texts.en:
Since 2010 Edibe has found a way to feel useful and generate her own income and she has managed to do this through selling bread and cakes.

Edibe is 44 years old and is a responsible, hard-working and helpful woman. She feels proud that she doesn't have to ask anyone for money as she earns her own living.

She is requesting a loan to buy bread wholesale, so that she can increase her sales. This business isn't very common in her neighborhood, which is why Edibe spends from six to eight hours on her business.

With your help Edibe will be able to buy more stock and make a better living. Show your support today!

loans.use: to buy bread wholesale so that she can increase her sales

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is earning a living in his farming activities, which is the primary source of income for his family. To generate additional earnings, he wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Hilario makes it a point to have good land preparation in order to have maximum yield and a good income. He recently needed a loan for the inter copping to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Hilario wishes to have more produce and to be able to supply agricultural commodities in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings

loans.name: Monserat

texts.en: Monserat  is from Pagadian. She and her husband have invested  in flower farm activities  for having end-to-end services in meeting the needs of the market for the freshest blooms, design, delivery and setup services for all occasions, whether intimate parties, corporate launches, memorial services or large weddings, among many others.. Recently, Monserat  took a loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals and hopes to yield more harvest. Monserat  deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals for her flower farm, so as to increase production

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married woman and owns a house that has no piped water but has electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.
 
Dorine has operated a tailoring business for the past 5 years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is 52 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business manufacturing native bags in the Philippines. Nancita has requested a 22,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her bags.

Nancita has been in this business for thirty years and in the future, she would like to build and expand it further.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bags.

loans.name: Yudelyn

texts.en:
Yudelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Yudelyn is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Yudelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Yudelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Yudelyn has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Yudelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  is 40 years old married woman and a mother of 5 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo. to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for selling from her general store.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a divorced woman and has three children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition from other competitors in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Hernando Luis

texts.es:
Hernando, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Momil, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Hernando solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos y alimento concentrado, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 5 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto.

El negocio de Hernando Necesita tu ayuda para salir adelante y progresar!
texts.en:
Hernando is a farmer with dreams and aspirations, who wants to support his family through his own hard work. For this reason, he started a pig-rearing business, a common trade in the town of Momil, which is known for the quality of the pigs raised in the area, as well as for good prices.

Hernando is requesting a loan to buy pigs and food concentrate to fatten them for sale. His only objective is to protect his family and and help them advance, and he is determined to succeed. He is driven and industrious, and works hard for 5 hours every day doing different tasks.

Hernando's business needs your help to succeed and grow!

loans.use: to buy pigs and food concentrate to fatten them for sale.

loans.name: Dagoberto Manuel

texts.es:
Dagoberto es un hombre de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa en una humilde finca en zona rural de Lorica. 

Durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

El se gana la vida con la cría y producción de pollos y cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

El trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
Apoya a Dagoberto a realizar su sueño!
texts.en:
Dagoberto is a farmer with drive and perseverance. He lives with his two children and his wife on a humble farm in a rural area of Lorica.

He has always had the courage and tenacity to provide for his children himself.
 
For the last 10 years he has worked raising chickens and fattening pigs in order to provide sufficient earnings to support his family.

He works every day, because his pigs need cleaning, feeding, and constant monitoring in order to ensure their correct development for eventual sale.

He is requesting the loan to buy pigs, concentrate and feed for his animals, to ensure better-nourished young which will provide better meat.

He dreams that his children will have professional jobs, and that they will receive the best education possible

Help Dagoberto make his dream come true!

loans.use: to buy pigs, food concentrate and feed for his animals in order to ensure better-nourished young.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 52 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, in the Philippines. She is married with 5 beautiful children. She is good at her farming activities and has had this business for many years. She requested a loan to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm. Also to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm; to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 34 years old, married to Veronicah and supports three children. 

He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 14 years, earning KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to lease a piece of land for farming to improve his production. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his farming activity. 

His future hope is to better his life.

loans.use: to lease a piece of land for farming to improve his production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells flour, washing soap, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are honest. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a big business.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carolyn is 44 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Carolyn has a farming citrus business in the Philippines. Carolyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Carolyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her citrus fruits business

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is married and has three children all of whom attend school. She lives at a  rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Misael Antonio

texts.es:
Misael se ha dedicado durante un tiempo a la venta de cerdos y de plátanos en el municipio de Lorica, desde allí intenta salir adelante día a día.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Misael podrá compra cerdos para la venta y tambien podrá aumentar su inventario de plátanos, de esta forma tendrá una mayor oferta y por ende mejores ingresos.

Confía siempre en la ayuda de interactuar para realizar su proceso productivo y espera que en un futuro pueda tener un gran progreso.

Impacta la vida de Misael con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en: Misael works selling pigs and bananas in the municipality of Lorica. There, he tries to get ahead day by day. With the help of a loan, Misael will be able to buy pigs to sell and also to increase his banana inventory. As a result, he will have a better supply and will have better earnings. He always relies in the help from Interactuar to handle his productive process,  and hopes that in the future he will have greater success. Make an impact in Misael's life today!

loans.use: To buy pigs to sell and also to increase his banana inventory

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana  is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her to inflate her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in different colors and designs

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 27 years old, married woman. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Sadia  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her  orders on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Concepcion is 58 years old now.

Concepcion has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a widowed woman who is 66 years old, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has an electronics repair business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials needed for her business.

Diosdada has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay registration fees for her son at senior high school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows to increase her milk production

loans.name: Ledilou

texts.en:
Ledilou is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Ledilou has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running her general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs. She aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 44 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. For the past ten years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Liezel has borrowed eight previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Liezel is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembes for farming her farm and fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better yield and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Alagoz

texts.en:
Alagoz is married with two sons. Her oldest son is married and the youngest is studying medicine at college. Alagoz and her lovely family are internally displaced persons (IDPs) living in the Füzuli region having left their native land in Füzuli city over 23 years ago. For the past four years, Alagoz has worked with cattle. She learned this profession from her mother-in-law and prepares dairy products such as milk, cheese, yogurt to sell in the local bazaar along with beef. 

Alagoz is requesting a 2,300 AZN loan to build a new stall for her cattle as her previous one has collapsed. She thanks Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to build a new cattle stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more farm produce for sale in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for improving soil fertility so as to get a better harvest and meet clients and family needs.

loans.name: Miyase

texts.en:
Miyase is married and has a child.  She started making and selling jewelry at home as a contribution to the family budget.  She sold the pieces to her neighbours.  When she needed to buy materials for jewelry, one her friend mentioned about micro credit.  With the help of her first loan, she purchased materials for her jewelry.  She made good sales and gained money thus improved her products.  With the help of the second loan she is planning to improve her designs and number of products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Evli bir çocuk annesi evlendikten sonra paraya ihtiyaçları olunca evde takı yapmaya başlamış.  Yakınlarına satışlar yapmış aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamaya başlamış.  Malzeme almaya ihtiyaç duyduğunda bir yakını mikro krediden bahsetmiş ve mikro kredi kullanarak takı malzemesi almış.  Aldığı malzeme ile takılar yaparak satmış ve para kazanmış işini geliştirmesine yardımcı olmuş.  İkinci kredi ile takı malzemesi alarak özgün takılar yaparak işini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for her jewelry making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer so as to increase soil nutrients for better farm produce, meeting both client and family needs.

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu is a married woman with three children. For the past 20 years, she has operated a business selling charcoal. Her primary customers are all kinds of people. Ndanu describes herself as honest and her biggest business challenge is the cost of transport. 

Ndanu is requesting a 65,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This will be her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Ndanu successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Laidou  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  LAIDOU sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KONDJIGUILA, un des villages de BAYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MARIAM, 3éme personne debout de   la gauche  vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Laidou are married women with an average age of 41 and on average five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kondjiguila, one of the villages of Baya, third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with the institution.

Mariam, the third person standing from left to right in the photo, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy farm supplies and seeds, and pay the fees for tillage to maintain one hectare. Her produce is sold in the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of dealers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 175,000 F CFA per crop season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for tillage, farm supplies, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizer and herbicide to spray his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feeds and medicine to enhance her poultry's health

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy cattle feed for high milk production and to supply more income.

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is a married woman with two children and is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She is 34 years old and both of her children attend school.

Gerlyn has operated a business in the Philippines buying and selling native bags for four years.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

In the future, Gerlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Matagi

texts.en:
Matagi is 39 years old and married to Beatrice. He supports three children. For the past 11 years, Matagi has been a small-scale farmer who earns 12,000 KES each month. 

Matagi is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to acquire a greenhouse to improve his farm production. This will be his first loan. Matagi plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to repay his debt and start a retail business. His future hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to acquire a greenhouse to improve his farm production

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells cooking fat, flour, washing soap, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Franciscah will use her KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Habibe

texts.en:
Habibe is married and a mother of two children. For a long time, she sewed at home as a hobby. After having children, Habibe continued sewing with the goal of earning money. She attended various courses and applied for her first microcredit loan that she used to purchase felt and materials. Habibe started a business sewing bags and vests to sell at bazaars and stands. 

Habibe is requesting a loan to buy more materials to sew bags and vests and develop her business. This will be her second loan. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Habibe hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Dikiş dikmeyi hobi olarak yapıyordu.  Çocukları olunca aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak amacıyla başlamış.  Çeşitli kurslara gitmiş.  Mikro krediden faydalanmak istemiş ve başvurmuş, ilk kredi ile keçe malzemesi almış.  Keçeden çanta ve yelek dikerek pazarlarda ve stantlarda satmış.  Para kazanmış ikinci kredi ile de malzeme alarak üretip satmak istiyor ve işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy materials to sew bags and vests

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a widowed woman with five children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Risper has been operating a business selling khangas (women's wrap clothing), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Yesica Patricia

texts.es:
Yesica tiene en su sangra el empuje y fuerza para trabajar, a pesar sus 30 años, aun se siente con toda la energía del mundo.

Es madre de 3 hijos menores y mayores por los cuales trabaja incansablemente para ofrecerles una vida digna.

Los ingresos los obtiene de su trabajo como porcicultora, pero este trabajo ha sido difícil por la competencia que se vive en las veredas del municipio de Momil.

Yesica solicita humildemente un apoyo para poder comprar lechones y alimento para los mismo, de este forma intentara superar estas dificultades y tendrá un mejor capital para trabajar.

El negocio de Yesica Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Yesica has the drive and strength to work in her blood.  Despite being 30 years old, she still has all the energy in the world.

She is the mother of three children, young and older, for whom she works tirelessly to offer them a worthy life.

She makes an income from her job raising pigs, but this job has been difficult for the competition that exists in the in the villages in the municipality of Momil.

Yesica is humbly requesting a loan to be able to buy piglets and food for them, in this way she intends to rise above these difficulties and have a better capital with which to work. 

Yesica's business could sustain her and get her ahead with your help!

loans.use: To buy piglets and food for them.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun is 54 years old and lives in a wooden house with his wife, who is a weaver, and their son, who is a student. He is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. Phoeun and his wife have three other children who are already working and/or married. He and his family own 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2013, Phoeun and his wife were trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus as well as for the empowerment of women by training them and offering sustainable work in the village. Phoeun is one of the fastest and the most motivated weavers.
