He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his poultry business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy an incubator in hopes that this will enable him to get more chicks to sell to other poultry farmers.

loans.name: Waldin Alcides

texts.es:
Waldin, de 27 años de edad, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a hacer bordados en manteles, solo tiene una niña que estudia kínder y con él vive su madre, su esposo, su hija y dos hermanos.

Waldin, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo, también cosecha mescal.- Tiene 8 años de sembrar mescal y 10 años de sembrar granos básicos, todo lo aprendió porque su padre trabajaba también en estas actividades y le dejo el motor que se necesita para ello y el decidió sembrar más mescal.- El terreno donde trabaja está atrás de su casa.

Waldin, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y para pagar la mano de obra que le ayuden.

Waldin, tiene 2 bovinos, pero sueña con aumentar su hato ganadero y tener vacas de ordeño para vender los lácteos.
texts.en:
Waldin is 27 years old and only studied until 4th grade.  He is in a relationship and his partner dedicates herself to embroidering tablecloths.  They only have one daughter who is studying in kindergarten.  His mother, his spouse, his daughter and two other siblings live with him.  

Waldin dedicates himself to the planting of basic grains like corn, beans, sorghum, and he also harvests mezcal.   He has planted mezcal for 8 years and basic grains for 10.  He learned everything from his father who also worked in these activities and left him the motor needed for the work, so he decided to plant more mescal.  His plot of land is behind his house.  

Weldon needs the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and to pay for manual labor.  Waldkin has 2 cows and dreams of increasing his livestock herd and have milking cows to sell the dairy products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pay for manual labor to assist him.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital to buy fertilizer. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to have more than 10 dairy cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar estudiando ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos para hacerlo y ademas su trabajo de jornalero no le cubre ni la cuarta parte de lo que pagaría por una cuota universitaria; ahora está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tienen un hijo de dos años de edad.

Orlando, después de culminar sus estudios de bachillerato se dedico a trabaja en la agricultura, para ayudarle a su padre y fue así como aprendió este oficio, luego un amigo le ofreció trabajar de cobrador en una ruta de buses y ahora trabaja de esa manera, decidió dedicarse a esto porque cuando los días son buenos en cuanto a viajes, así es también su paga, horario no tiene puesto que los viajes son rotativos.

Orlando, necesita el dinero para ampliar su vivienda y comprar algunos muebles que le hacen falta, esto es para dale una mejora calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo.

El sueño de Orlando es tener una vivienda más digna, más amplia y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Orlando is 23 years old.  He studied up to high school.  He could not continue studying since his parents didn't have the resources to do it and besides, his work as a day labourer didn't even cover a quarter of what he would need to pay in university fees.  He is now in a relationship.  His partner works at the domestic chores and they have a two-year-old child.

Orlando, after finishing his high school studies, worked in agriculture in order to help his father and that is how he learned that trade.  Later, a friend offered him work as a conductor on a bus route and that is what he does now.  He decided to work at this because when the days are good for trips so is his pay.  His schedule is not fixed since the trips are rotated.

Orlando needs the money to extend his home and to buy some necessary furniture.  This is to give his little son a better quality of life.

Orlando's dream is to have a house that is more dignified, larger and in better condition.

loans.use: to extend his house and buy some needed furniture

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat  is 40 years old, a married woman, with 7 children, running a business of selling milk for many years, with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area and her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increased milk sales to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Jose Justo

texts.es:
Justo, de 71 años de edad, es muy conocido por su trabajo en pro del desarrollo de su comunidad, está casado y vive con su esposa que se dedica a los oficios del hogar y con sus 3 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela del cantón y a la ves le ayudan a cultivar granos básicos como maíz, frijol y sorgo.

Justo, toda su vida se ha dedicado al cultivo de granos básicos, ya que su padre le enseño muy bien como hacerlo, además es líder de la comunidad, ya que representa la comunidad como presidente de la ADESCO.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar 4 sacos de fertilizante para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya que se esta acercando la primer fertilizada y lo necesita de urgencia.

Justo, quiere en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y enseñarles a través sus consejos a ser muy responsables.
texts.en:
Justo, 71 years old, is very well known for his work promoting development in his community.  He is married and lives with his wife.  She takes care of the household chores and their three children, all of whom are students in the community school.  At the same time, she helps him to grow basic grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum.

All his life Justo has worked growing basic grains, because his father taught him well how to do that.  Additionally, he is a leader in the community, because he represents the community as the president of ADESCO.

He needs the money from this loan to buy four bags of fertilizer in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.  The first fertilizing window is approaching, and he urgently needs it.

In the future, Justo wants to have a better quality of life for his children, and to teach them through his advice to be very responsible.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fertilizer in order to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is 54 years old, married and blessed with five children. He has a retail shop and has been running the business for 15 years. He will be using the loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to expand his retail shop and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, rice, milk, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell. He hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits, vegetables and cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and have many outlets. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with three children  who all attend school. He lives at his own house that  has electricity but no piped water.His monthly expenses are food and school fees.
He has operated a motorcycle business for the past three years. He mentioned seasonality  and competition as a major challenge in his place of operation .

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase construction materials to build a house. He decided to join Yehu to boost his business and improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Manuel Roberto

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre luchador, de estado civil casado actualmente vive solo con su esposa con la cual tuvo siete hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, ellos viven en el Recinto Pueblo Nuevo a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos que está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha, su gente es muy devota de la Virgen de los Remedios a la misma le festejan el 8 de diciembre de cada año. 
Don Manuel viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual solo tiene estudios primarios a pesar de esto salió adelante trabajando como jornalero y tienen su casa un pequeño invernadero con productos de la zona de esta manera ha sabido  mantener a su familia, en la actualidad sigue luchando día a día por su esposa quien es su compañera y su razón de vivir a pesar de su edad sigue trabajando en una finca del sector cuidando y ordeñando ganado, también en su propiedad sigue con el invernadero para ayudarse en la alimentación.
El negocio que emprenderá es la crianza de cerdos le dedicará un promedio de 5 horas diarias, tiene construidos los corrales y con la ayuda de su esposa buscará salir adelante, el señor Manuel conoce muy bien de este negocio porque lo aprendió con sus Padres y anteriormente ya ha trabajado cuidando cerdos. 
El señor Manuel tiene muchos sueños por cumplir como lo es tener su gran negocio y dedicarse solo a eso y dejar de trabajar para otras personas. 
Este préstamo ayudará a Don Manuel a mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un mejor futuro a su esposa, agradece a Kiva por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como él que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Manuel is a hard working, married man. He currently lives just with his wife with whom he had seven children, all adults and independent. They live in Recinto Pueblo Nuevo, fifteen minutes from the San Miguel de los Bancos neighborhood which is located in the northeast of the Pichincha province. The people are very devoted to the Virgen de los Remedios (Virgin Mary) and celebrate the same on December 8th of each year.

Manuel comes from a low income family which is the reason why he has only a primary school education. In spite of this, he moved forward working as a day laborer. They have a small greenhouse at their home with produce from the area. He has been able to maintain her family in this way. Currently, he continues struggling day to day for his wife who is his companion and his reason for living. In spite of his age, he continues working at a farm in the area, caring for and milking cattle. He also continues with the greenhouse on his property to help out with food.

The business he will start is the raising of pigs, to which he will dedicate an average of 5 hours per day. He has the pens built and will seek out success with the help of his wife. 

Manuel knows this business very well because he learned it from his parents and has previously worked caring for pigs. Manuel has many dreams to fulfill such as owning his great business, dedicating himself to only that and no longer working for other people.

This loan will help Manuel to improve his quality of life and provide his wife with a better future. He thanks Kiva for the support they are providing to people like him who, lacking opportunities, have been unable to accomplish their goals.

loans.use: to start his business raising pigs to, in that way, provide his wife and family with a better future.

loans.name: Ellujoy

texts.en: Ellujoy is a female Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have a big store within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un empresario de 45 años de edad dedica a la venta informal de electrodomésticos, artículos para el hogar, trabaja solo es independiente, su método de trabajo es salir y recorrer las calles de Sincelejo ofreciendo productos muy comerciales como ventiladores yd ando comodidades de pagos a las personas.

Gustavo es padre de 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, vive con su pareja la cual es ama de casa y él se encarga de dar el sustento y calidad de vida en el hogar.

Entre sus más deseados sueños están pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello necesita mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, llegar a otras zonas. Gustavo piensa a futuro, tener un local propio el cual lo pueda atender su pareja y el seguir con su labor en las calles. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ventiladores, electrométricos, acolchados y productos decorativos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who sells electrical appliances and home products informally. He works independently. His work method is to walk the streets of Sincelejo offering products such as fans and providing comfortable payment options to people. 

Gustavo has three children ages 15, 12 and 9. He lives with his partner who stays at home. He is in charge of providing for the family. 

His biggest dreams include paying for his children's education and improving the living conditions of their home. This is why he needs to improve his sales, increase his customers and profits and to reach new areas. Gustavo is thinking of the future. He wants to have his own store, which could be managed by his partner and he could continue working on the streets. 

He is requesting this loan to buy fans, electrical appliances, cushions and decorative home products.

loans.use: to buy fans, electrical appliances, cushions and decorative products for the home.

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en: The members are part of Nyonko group and are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of three members. The members’ businesses include smoked fish and pastries. This loan will help with their small businesses, including Joyce's. This is her fourth loan from ID-Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling pastries and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents recommendation. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more flour, margarine, sugar and baking powder to prepare pastries and cake and sell to her customers. This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has four children. When asked what she likes abut ID-Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total of GHS 3,600 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, sugar and baking powder to prepare pastries and cake and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Negba Peace Group

texts.en:
This group of two women is called the Negba Peace Group. Their average age is 50 years old. They both live in traditional extended families in Teshie, one of the neighborhoods in Accra, Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together, buying and selling such items as eggs and cooking utensils. After successfully repaying all their previous loans, this is the eighth group loan for the women of the Negba Group. 

Diana is a member of this group and intends to use her loan funds to buy cooking utensils. She purchases her supplies at neighboring markets and sells to diverse clients of women and men, who pay in cash. Diana hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to meet her expenses related to health, food and clothing. She will reinvest the remainder into her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a Babban Gona farmer from Dauro Vilage. Sunday joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s loan, Sunday will has access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Sunday would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Peace and Unity Group, and they are beginning their fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of six members. 

The members’ businesses include selling smoked fish, slippers, dresses, plastic bowls and groceries. The group will need a total amount of 4,600 GHS to better their businesses. This loan will help their small businesses, including Elizabeth A. This is Elizabeth's fifth loan from ID Ghana, after having joined at a friend’s invitation. Elizabeth has a business selling smoked fish and says that she started the business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. 

Elizabeth will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish for customers. This work will allow her to generate an income to support her family. She is single mother of one child. When asked what she likes abut ID Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish for customers.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
These members form a group called Yehowa Akwe. They are on their forth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has two members. They sell second hand clothing and bread. The featured borrower is Esther, who is 47 years old, and a married woman with four children. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Esther is a member. She says that this is the forth time she has joined ID Ghana. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. 

Currently, Esther has a business selling second hand clothing. She buys second hand clothing from the main market at wholesale prices and sells them to her customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had, but that it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow the business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,600 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing from the main market at wholesale prices and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dauro Village. Mary joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mary will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mary now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income, and will use her extra earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farm's yields.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dauro Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Dauda suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income, and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Yahaya Dauda

texts.en:
Yahaya Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dauro Village. Yahaya Dauda joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Yahaya Dauda suffered from poor yields that hindered his ability to improve his farming skills. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income, and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30’s, is a widow with five children, four are still in school and one is a grown-up.  She has been a food vendor for ten years now and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Rose used the previous loans to keep on increasing the food stock and has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profits to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land, built her house, bought a TV set and a sofa set, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to restore the out-of-stock items in the food store. She dreams of taking her kids to good schools.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group LINDI, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Johana Andrea

texts.es:
Johana es una persona creativa, emprendedora muy activa, gracias a su negocio de venta de mecharía puede generar buena calidad de vida y expectativa de un mejor futuro, uno donde sus hijos tengan todas las herramientas necesarias para salir adelante, que puedan estudiar, trabajar, formarse, tener una alimentación digna y todo gracias a Johana que sale todos los días 8 horas a vender ropa, calzado y accesorios en acero.

Solicita un préstamo para potenciar su comercio de joyería, a los clientes le ha gustado mucho y piden más por ello quiere invertir  en la compra de manillas, pulseras, aretes, relojes realizados en acero y splash.

Tu préstamo ayudara a Johana a diversificar y aumentar su inventario, generando más ventas que ayudaran a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y de sus dos hijos de 19 y 3 años de edad.
texts.en:
Johana is a creative and very enterprising person.  Thanks to her business selling merchandise she is able to have a good quality of life and look forward to a better future. One where her children will have all the necessary tools to get ahead. They will be able to study, work, educate themselves and eat decent meals, all thanks to Johanna who works 8 hours a day selling clothes, shoes, and accessories made of steel. 

She is requesting a loan to stock her jewelry business. Her clients have really liked it and have asked for more so she wants to invest in cuffs, bracelets, earrings, and watches made out of steel and rhinestones.  Your loan will help Johana diversify and increase her inventory, generating more sales which will help her improve conditions in her home and for her two children who are 19 and 3 years old.

loans.use: to stock her jewelry business. She will buy rings, bracelets, earrings, and watches made of steel.

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  MAIMOUNA , 1ère personne debout de la  droite vers la   gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de SAFECORE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Seneyiriwaton-I group are married women who on the average are 42 years of age and have five children. They all live in polygamous households in Safecore, a village in Sanankoroba, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

They grow millet, which is what Maimouna does, for example. She is the first one standing from right to left in the photo. With her loan, Maimouna plans to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds as well as pay the cost of labor to work 1.5 ha [1.2 acres ] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce in Safecore, to a customer base composed of both resellers and consumers. Maimouna plans to earn an average of 155,000 CFA francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her children's clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower, 54, is a single mother with two children. She makes her living selling vegetables on the street from 7 am to 5 pm. During the winter, she sells coffee and pastries in the evenings. 

In 2009, one of her sons fell ill with multi-drug resistant TB. He has been undergoing treatment, has had surgery and is now on his way to recovery. The borrower, who had been a domestic worker, quit her job and started working in the streets close to her home, in order to be close to her son. Presently, she would like to have her own market stall in order to increase her earnings and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To expand food sales in her market stall

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование среднее, с 2009 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Фотимы, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы и 6 овец. На земельном участке мерою 0,24 ГА собственной земли, Фотима выращивает органический картофель. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 19,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фотима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для реализации экологически-чистого молока и семян картофеля. Фотима планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Fotima is 42 years old, married and  the mother of two. She has received secondary education. Since 2009 she has been doing farm work. Thanks to Fatima's hard work, at present she has three cows and six sheep on her farm. Fotima also grows organic potatoes on her own field of 0.24 ha [0.6 acres]. Her business revenue is 19,000 soms (KGS) per month. 

In order to develop her business further, Fotima has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy dairy cows in order to be able to sell environmentally clean milk, as well as potato seeds. Fotima plans to invest the resulting revenue in a further growth of her business, and eventually save up for home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic milk sales, as well as potato seeds.

loans.name: Rosemberg

texts.en: Rosemberg is a farmer who has always lived in the locality of Las Perlas and nowadays he lives with his wife.  Las Perlas has only 232 residents and it is located in Margaritas´ Municipality in the state of Chiapas.  Las Perlas is located in the jungle area of the state, where most of the communities live in marginalized and vulnerable conditions. Rosemberg is one of the farmers of the locality. He cultivates corn and beans during the season. Rosemberg wants to buy a solar system to light his house to improve his wife's and his living conditions. With the solar system, he will be able to cut off the kernels of maize at night while spending time with his wife. Also, with the solar system they would be able to see better at night and replace the use of candles.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light his house better, replace the use of candles and be able to work after sunset.

loans.name: Salamatzhan

texts.ru: Саламатжан, 61 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Все дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В хозяйстве Саламатжан на сегодняшний день есть: 4 коровы, лошадь, 20 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,0 ГА, она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход Саламатжан составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от бизнеса помогут Саламатжан развить и приумножить ее бизнес.
texts.en: Salamatzhan is 61, married, and the mother of 4 children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and has worked for many years as a crop and livestock farmer.   All the children in the family actively help with chores.  Salamatzhan currently has 4 cows, a horse, and 20 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.0-hectare plot of her own land for growing carrots.  Salatmatzhan's monthly income is around 16,000 som.  For the future development of her farm, she's turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som to buy livestock for increasing the size of her herd.  The income from her business will help Salamatzhan develop and further expand her business.

loans.use: buy some livestock to bolster her herd

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  9 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  AMI  ZOUMANA , 1ère personne assise de la gauche    vers la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de SAFECORE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of group Seneyiriwaton II are married women. They are on average 45 years old with four children, and they all live in polygamous families in Safecore, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, Mali’s second administrative region. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth farming loan with the institution.

In the case of Ami Zoumana, the first woman to the left in the photo’s sitting row, the cultivated species is millet. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 1.2-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold locally in Safecore to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

Ami Zoumana forecasts an average profit of 150,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth farming loan with the institution.

In the case of Saly, the woman standing to the right in the photo, the cultivated species is millet. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 1.2-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold locally in Safecore to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

She forecasts an average profit of 100,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy feed for her dairy cows and she hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk, with his beloved wife, lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. This couple, in different periods of their life, has been engaged in various work, but now Hayk is busy with farming and agriculture with the help of his wife. On his farm, Hayk has only cows and calves and the farm products that he sells are milk, macun (national dairy products), some cheese and also a little meat. On his plot of land, Hayk raises potatoes, tomatoes, peppers and cucumber. Twice a week, with his wife, he organizes the sale of his products at the wholesale market in the city. The income is small but Hayk’s hope is great that thanks to this Kiva loan, he can increase his income and improve their living conditions. With this loan amount, he wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bargi Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ibrahim suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 2.5-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold at the market to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

She forecasts an average profit of 100,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 32-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works selling cosmetics and accessories in a stall. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income.

Sulaiman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell for his business. By taking this loan, Sulaiman will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Sulaiman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry for sale to clients to earn a living.

loans.name: Hudu

texts.en: Hudu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bargi Village. He joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hudu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hudu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These three members, led by Alice as the representative, are part of the group called Biakoye. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling vegetables, shrimps, millet, charcoal and secondhand clothing. They will need a total amount of GHS 3,300 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Alice is a member.

Alice says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her fourth loan request with ID-Ghana. She currently has a business selling onions, peppers and shrimps. Alice will use her part of this loan, GHS 1,000, to increase her capital. She will buy onions, peppers and shrimps to sell to customers. She will sell them by distributing them to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family.

Alice is 37 years old, single and has three dependent children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Alice replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy onions, peppers and shrimps to sell to customers.

loans.name: Djiguignouma I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   FERIMA,  1 ère personne debout de la  droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Djiguignouma I are married women. They are on average 46 years old with four children, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, in Mali’s second administrative region. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh farming loan with the institution. Previous loans were repaid punctually.

For Ferima, the first person standing from the right in the photo, the cultivated species is groundnut. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 1.25-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold locally in the village to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

She forecasts an average profit of 80,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.

Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   FATOUMATA  B,  1 ère personne assise de la   gauche vers la    droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of group Djiguignouma II are married women. They are on average 33 years old with four children, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, in Mali’s second administrative region. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh farming loan with the institution. Previous loans were repaid punctually.

For Fatoumata B, the first person sitting from the left in the photo, the cultivated species is groundnut. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 1.25-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold locally in the village to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

She forecasts an average profit of 150,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Shayma

texts.en:
Shayma is a 25-year-old married woman from Khan Younis city. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Shayma works at selling kids clothes in a stall. It is a good business and provides the family with a good income.

Shayma took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products to resell in her business. By taking this loan, Shayma will be able to increase her sales and also her income.

Shayma appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in her business

loans.name: Djiguignouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   MINATA   D  ,  1 ère personne debout de la    droite   vers la gauche   de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Djiguignouma III are married women. They are on average 37 years old with four children, and all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, in Mali’s second administrative region. They collaborate with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh farming loan with the institution. Previous loans were repaid punctually.

For Minata D, the first person standing from the right in the photo, the cultivated species is groundnut. With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay plowing fees to maintain her 1.25-acre lot. After the harvest, production is sold locally in the village to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers.

She forecasts an average profit of 175,000 XOF per campaign. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Delton

texts.en: Delton is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Bintiheri

texts.en:
Bintiheri is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

Bintiheri operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 10 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Bintiheri dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs to use to increase her produce.

loans.name: Ferzana

texts.en:
Ferzana is 40 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Ferzana’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Ferzana has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ferzana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Chisinde

texts.en:
Chisinde is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her area of operation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Roberto's Group

texts.en:
Roberto is a farmer who lives with his wife and children in the locality of Las Perlas, which is located in the municipality of Las Margaritas in the state of Chiapas. Las Perlas is located in the jungle area of the state, where most of the communities live in marginalized and vulnerable conditions. 

Las Perlas is a community with only 232 residents who are organized and take care of the environment. Roberto is the community’s leader. He wants to purchase a solar energy system to improve his family´s living conditions and replace the use of candles and firewood. He also wants to encourage other members of the community by setting an example of how to become environmentally friendly and use sustainable solar power to improve the living conditions of the entire community.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to improve his family's living conditions and also to encourage the entire community to switch to alternative energy sources.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   SENIDIA   ,  1 ère personne assise de la     gauche vers la    droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djiguignouma IV group are married women who on average are 40 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of Sanankoroba, the second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh crop year loan with the institution, and past loans were repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Sendia, the first person sitting from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres).

After harvesting the production is sold at village level, to a client base consisting of re-sellers and consumers. She expects to achieve average profits of 170,000 CFA francs per growing season.

These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband in dealing with daily expenses.

loans.use: Pay for plowing; buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 45 years old. She sells candy, potato chips and other snacks from a street stand located near a movie theater. With much effort, Carmen obtained a little apartment where she lives with her nine-year-old son. She needs a loan to complete the payments for her apartment. Carmen hopes you can help her, because she is happy and healthy living there and she is working hard.

loans.use: to finish paying for her apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cartons of eggs

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Semeni, who is in her late 40s, is married with five children. Two of the children are still in school and three are grown up. She has been running a pub for thirteen years. She used to have a grocery store business. She works from 9:00 am to midnight every day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Semeni’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start the pub business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, a radio, built her own house, covered household expenses and paid back the loan. She will use this loan to renovate the roof of the pub and to buy beverages. She dreams of expanding her pub.

Semeni will share this loan with her loan group, Agano, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to renovate the roof of her pub and to buy beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
Leticia lives with her family in the Locality of Las Perlas, which is located in Las Margaritas Municipality in the state of Chiapas. The Locality has only 232 residents who live in an organized way, most of the residents working in agriculture. Las Perlas is situated in the jungle area of the state, where it is common to harvest maize and coffee because of the climate conditions.

Leticia is a farmer who works all year in the cultivation of corn and coffee but she only gets paid during harvest season. Leticia's family, as all the community, do not have access to basic needs like electricity so she wants to purchase a solar system to light her house. With the solar system she would replace the use of firewood and candles and her family and she would be able to spend time with each other during night.

loans.use: to replace the use of candles and firewood and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tawakiri Village. Yusuf  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertiliser, herbicides, and improved seeds. These items will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. His household income will increase considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yusuf now has the opportunity to increase his yield and income and use his additional earnings to diversify his farm  and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Tupo Juu Sana Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani, who is in his early 20s, is married with one small child. He has been running two projects for two years now: transportation (motorcycle) and a genge (grocery store). He works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ramadhani’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to service his motorcycle and start the genge business. He has paid back his loan successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to reinvest in his business, pay back the loan, take care of his family, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to service his motorcycle and to buy stock for the genge business. He dreams of buying a plot of land.

Ramadhani will share this loan with his loan group, Tupo Juu Sana, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and to buy stock for his genge (grocery store).

loans.name: Istiphanus

texts.en:
Istiphanus is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda Village. He joined Babban Gona to realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Istiphanus no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for his family. He will have access to farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  His income will increase considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Istiphanus  has the opportunity to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tawakiri Village. Rahila joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of her family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, she no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed her family. Rahila will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Rahila has set high goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize.  Rahila has made it her ultimate goal to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Musa Kalle

texts.en:
Musa Kalle is a Babban Gona farmer from Dankwaire Village. He joined Babban Gona to realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa Kalle no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farm. He will have access to farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides ,and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  His income will increase considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa Kalle has the opportunity to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Otgonchimeg

texts.en:
Otgonchimeg is a  28-year-old woman who lives with her parents, brother, and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been a photographer for ten years. Her mother is also photographer and they  work in Ulaanbaatar. She earns additional income at a driver training center where she works as clerk. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,050 USD to buy  bricks, cement, and planks to expand her house so that her family will live in a comfortable and spacious place. and burn less coal for heating.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her house.

loans.name: Ma. Jenilda

texts.en:
Ma. Jenilda is a 51-year-old married woman who works hard to help her husband.

She has a food vending business and  earns additional income raising pigs.  Ma. Jenilda is borrowing  20,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of pizza to sell.

Ma. Jenilda has sustained her business through  23 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of pizza to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman works who hard to support her family by operating a fishing business for 8 years.

Cheryl requested  21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Yahaya Jakada

texts.en:
Yahaya Jakada is a Babban Gona farmer from Tawakiri Village. He joined Babban Gona to realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yahaya Jakada no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve his farming skills. He will have access to farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  His income will increase considerably.  

This season Yahaya Jakada has ambitious plans to harvest 42 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Jakada now has the opportunity to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a  71-year-old married woman withsix children.  

She has been in the agricultural business  for 5 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

She has previously borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 35-year-old married woman with two children and works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store  for 15 years and requested 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase candles, chips, noodles, soap, and sugar.

Arlene has previously borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF. She earns an income selling vegetables.

Arlene aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase candles, chips, noodles, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a 59-year-old married woman with four children and works hard to provide for her family. 

She has run a general store for 10 years and requested 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned good and personal care products.

Dulce has previously borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income from food vending.

Dulce aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children who runs a general store. She requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell.

She earns additional income through other business ventures (selling rice).

Herminia dreams of saving enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  household goods to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a 34-year-old married woman with two children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 6 years and requests  15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Carina has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income growing rice.

Carina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 43-year-old married woman with three children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 3 years and requests  20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Emma has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income growing rice.

Emma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 61 years old and married with five children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF. 

Imelda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Ariane

texts.fr: Arianne, 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Depuis tantôt 10ans, elle a ouvert un dépôt de boissons gazeuses dans sa zone. Grâce à cette activité, elle arrive à contribuer aux besoins de ses enfants en l’absence de son mari qui vit à l’étranger. Excellente femme d’affaire, Arianne a déjà bénéficié de prêts, ce qui lui a permis de faire progresser son commerce. Elle désire augmenter son revenu et mieux investir dans l’éducation de ses enfants. Tenant compte des fortes demandes de sa clientèle, elle a demandé un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
47-year-old Arianne is married and has four children who are all in school. For nearly 10 years, she has been operating a soft drink depot in her area.

Through this activity, she manages to meet her children's needs, in her husband's absence, who lives abroad. An excellent businesswoman, Arianne has already benefited from loans, which enabled her to develop her business.

She wants to increase her income and better invest in her children's education. Taking into account her customers' high demands, she applied for a micro-credit loan to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: buy a stock supply of soft drinks

loans.name: May May

texts.en:
May May is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling pearls in the Philippines. May May has been in this business for 9 years. May May earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more pearls to sell.

May May has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pearls to sell.

loans.name: Irodahon

texts.ru: Иродахон, 25 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 5 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Иродахон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,70 ГА собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Иродахон составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Иродахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров. Иродахон намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Irodahon is 25 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and for five years already she has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her perseverance, dedication and hard work, she currently has two cows on her farm.  She also grows corn on 0.7 hectares of her own land and one hectare of rented land.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  Irodahon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows.  She intends to further increase her cattle headcount and to continue to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.fr:
Bruno est marié et père de trois enfants. Il est très fier de sa petite famille. Il a 30 ans. C'est un père diligent et déterminé lorsqu'il est question du bien-être des siens, il s'efforce toujours de leurs offrir le meilleur.
Bruno gagne sa vie en exerçant une activité de vente des chaussures à l'occasion. Il fait de la vente ambulante, il se déplace tous les jours dans les différents grands marchés des villes environnants. Sa femme l'aide beaucoup dans l'exercice de cette activité. Ils y travaillent ensemble. Il est dans cette affaire, il y a maintenant 8 ans.
Il est très motivé d'épargner, son objectif est de pouvoir construire une maison, agrandir leurs activités agricoles  à la campagne, et d'offrir une meilleur éducation à ses trois petits enfants.
texts.en:
Bruno is married with three children, and is very proud of his family. He is a 30-year-old father, diligent and determined when it concerns his family's welfare, always striving to offer them the best he can.

Bruno earns a living selling used shoes. He is an ambulant vendor, and moves every day to the different main markets of surrounding cities. His wife helps him a lot in the course of this activity in which they work together. He has been in this business for the past eight years.

He is highly motivated to save, his goal being to build a house, expand their agricultural activities in the countryside, and offer a better education to his three small children.

loans.use: buy four bales of used shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy 150 kilos of salt-water fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Henri Hanitra

texts.fr:
Henri Hanitra est une femme travailleuse de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.
Avant 2011, elle était commerçante, elle était vendeuse ambulante des appareils électroménagers. Elle ne supportait pas le rythme, et elle était tombée malade. Depuis, son mari lui a suggéré de changer d'activité et pratiquer sa connaissance en couture et rester à la maison et elle a accepté et a commencé la confection des trousses de différents modèles. Et cette activité la passionne beaucoup et son mari travaille avec elle, c'est lui qui assure l'approvisionnement des matières premières, la vente et la livraison. Quant à elle, elle reste à la maison pour faire la confection. Elle commence maintenant avoir des clients dans les autres provinces.
Leur projet est de pouvoir ouvrir un atelier, acquérir beaucoup de clients en dehors de la capitale.
texts.en:
Henri Hanitra is a hard-working 48-year-old. She is married and a mother of four children who go to school. Before 2011, she worked as a merchant where she traveled around and sold domestic appliances. However, the pace of the job was too much and she became sick. After that, her husband suggested she change her work and use her knowledge of sewing to stay at home. She accepted this and started making different types of small bags. 

Henri Hanitra loves this work now, and her husband works with her by procuring the materials, making the sales and deliveries. For her part, she stays at home and sews the bags. She has now started to have customers from other provinces. 

They hope to be able to open a shop and acquire many customers from outside the capital.

loans.use: to buy fasteners, sponges, linings, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various toys

loans.name: Honoré Jean Bernard

texts.fr:
Honoré Jean Bernard est un père de famille travailleur de 41 ans, il est marié et sa femme ne travaille pas. Leurs enfants (10-12-14-18 ans)  fréquentent une école privée en milieu rural. 
La vente de poissons et d’autres produits de mer séchés est une activité exercée par Honoré Jean Bernard durant 11 ans. C’est une activité tirée de l’expérience de son frère.Le prêt  va servir d’acheter différents sortes de produits  séchés : crevette,  anguille, et autres poissons séchés destinés à augmenter le stock de produits.
L’objectif est de pouvoir s’approvisionner directement sur la zone côtière et à moindre coût et de devenir un grossiste dans l’activité ; à cela s’ajoute le développement de l’élevage et de l’agriculture en milieu rural.
texts.en:
Honoré Jean Bernard is a father of a family. He is 41 years old and a hard worker. He is married and his wife does not work. Their children, who are 10, 12, 14, and 18 years old, go to a private school in a rural area.

For 11 years, Honoré Jean Bernard has worked selling fish and other dried seafood. He learned this work from his brother. 

This loan is going to serve to buy various types of dried seafood: shrimp, eel, and other fish, which will increase his stock.

His goal is to be able to procure goods directly from the coast and less from wholesalers. In addition, he wishes to get into raising livestock and farming in the rural area.

loans.use: to buy various types of dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, dresses, and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Abeline Paulette

texts.fr:
Disposant de 16 années d’expérience professionnelle, Abeline Paulette  s’adonne à l’activité de préparation et de livraison de piments conditionnés. En effet, elle a acquis des connaissances dans le domaine durant son expérience dans une unité de snack bar implantée dans la zone côtière. Avec le prêt, elle va  acheter 300 kg  de piments rouge et vert  et des ingrédients tels que vinaigre, ail, huile, sel, gingembre pour l’activité de vente de piments  
Abeline Paulette a 59 ans, et a 4 enfants dont 3 sont déjà marié et son dernier enfant , encore en quête d’emploi , vit encore chez elle. Son ex-mari qui  travaille en  zone côtière est déjà marié, mais ils (Abeline Paulette et son ex-mari) ne sont pas encore légalement séparés. Son  mari continue encore de l’appuyer financièrement mensuellement. Son rêve est de devenir exportateur dans la filière, elle prévoit d’acquérir une machine pour la transformation des produits en grande quantité
texts.en:
With 16 years of experience in the profession behind her, Abeline Paulette prepares and delivers conditioned chillies. She acquired her knowledge in this domain during her experience working in a snack bar situated in the coastal region. With her loan, she will buy 300kgs of red and green chillies and ingredients such as vinegar, garlic, oil, salt, and ginger for her business selling chillies.
Abeline Paulette is 59 years old with four children, of whom three are already married. Her youngest child, who is looking for a job, still lives with her. Her ex-husband who works in the coastal region has remarried, but they (Abilene Paulette and her ex-husband) are not yet legally separated. Her husband continues to help her financially every month. Her dream is to go into exportation in her field. She plans to buy a machine to transform her products in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy 300kgs of red and green chillies and ingredients (vinegar, garlic, oil, salt, and ginger).

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia Claudia  se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Claudia, continues working in her grocery store and restaurant business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. The member, though this business, wants to get ahead. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. The member's dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy deodorants, perfume, shampoo, lotions, scrubs, earrings, etc...

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es: Elba tiene 37 años de edad y cada día pone todo su esfuerzo y su carisma para atraer una mayor cantidad de clientes que adquieran sus productos que consiste en: pan francés y pan dulce, el cual ella misma elabora en su vivienda. Elba vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad a los que apoya para que estudien, ya que quiere que tengan un mejor futuro. Elba desea mejorar su vivienda, y para ello construirá las paredes del corredor para formar un cuarto que le servirá para ampliar su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio.
texts.en: Elba is 37 years old and each day she puts all her effort and charisma into attracting a greater quantity of customers who buy her products which consist of French bread and sweet bread, which she makes herself in her house. Elba lives with her two children, ages 15 and 8, in a house she owns, and she supports them in their schooling, since she wants them to have a better future.
