Elba wants to improve her house, and for this she will build walls on the outdoor hallway to make a room which will serve to expand her business, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and metal to build a room on her house and, in this way, improve her quality of life and that of her family, and improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and metal to build a room on her house.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María, de 32 años de edad, es una señora humilde y muy trabajadora, ya que ha sabido educar muy bien a sus hijos, enseñándole valores muy importantes, a la ves ha sido muy valiente, ya que ha mantenido a sus hijos sola, pues es madre soltera. 

María, trabaja lavando la ropa de una vecina, le paga semanalmente $30 y es de esos pequeños ingresos que va sacando poco a poco a sus hijos adelante, para que estudien y sean en un futuro profesionales.- Además, se dedica a la agricultura, este año cultivará 7,000 metros de maíz para ir diversificando sus ingresos. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas, semilla de buena calidad y fertilizantes, todo eso será fundamental para el desarrollo de su cultivo, para obtener buena producción. 

María, quiere que sus hijos salgan adelante con sus estudios y espera verlos a todos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 32 years old, is a humble and hard-working woman. She has known to raise her children very well, teaching them very important values, and also being courageous, since she has supported her children alone, because she is a single mother. 

María works washing her neighbor's clothing, and is paid $30 weekly, and it is from this small income, that she has gotten her children ahead little by little, so that they can go to school and, in the future, be professionals. In addition, she works in agriculture. This year she will plant 7,000 square meters of corn to diversity her income.

She needs the loan to purchase herbicides, insecticides, good quality seeds, and fertilizers, all of this will be fundamental for the development of her crop, to get a good harvest. 

María wants her children to get ahead in their education and hopes to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides, insecticides, good quality seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin works hard to support her family. Elvin is single and has a business farming corn, rice, coconut and sugarcane in the Philippines.

Elvin requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvin has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Elvin would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Union Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Janice ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
La scoia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member Janice is partnered, is 38 years old, and has 2 children. The member works in her craft business; she sells knit items, sweaters, blankets, and woven items. The member sells different knit items. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. The member is a hard-working and enterprising woman who, through this business, wants to get her children ahead. The member has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business selling knit and woven items. The member asks for the loan to purchase knit items, sweaters, and woven items.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo took the photo after the meeting since she asked permission due to work reasons. 

The other members work in their businesses of selling crafts, selling clothing, in a grocery store, and selling beauty products.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase knit items, sweaters and woven items.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is engaged in the livestock business, particularly in raising hogs. He has been in this kind of business since 1980. 

With his hard work and patience, he has been able to maintain his business. He also offers repairs for motorcycle and has a vulcanizing shop. His wife has been selling gasoline and tires. 

The couple work hard to let their other two children finish their studies since his other three children are already working. During his free time, he uses his motorcycle to transport passengers going to and from other barangays (villages). 

Omar would like to keep his hog raising business profitable. That’s the reason why he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. He will use his loan in buying stocks of feed, vaccines, and medicines for his hogs.

loans.use: to be use in buying stocks of feed, vaccines, and medicines for his hograising business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 30 years old and married.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Delia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 29 year old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lorena has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her mat weaving business.

Lorena has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her mat weaving business

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette works in a business in the free zone, the idea of creating a general store came from a member of the family who has already worked in this field. The training she received from CEFOR helped her a lot in the diversification of her products. She also works in other areas such as the delivery of basic necessities and blankets. She has been working in commerce for nine years.
She is 35 and married to a driver. They have three children (16,11 and three years), of whom two attend a private school.
Her goal is to be able to open another shop in order to increase her income to enable her to provide for her children's education, and to buy some rice fields in the rural area.

loans.use: to buy products of basic necessity and blankets.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 2 and 15 years.  3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve their welfare and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Nimfa has been in this business for 11 years and earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Ponciana has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence aged 38 years. She is married with 1 child aged 17 years, who goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested the maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her child and  to renovate her house.

 The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine, 34, is married and has two children, age 2 and 6 years. One of them goes to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 3 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 56 años de edad, es muy trabajador, vive con sus 3 hijos de 7, 15 y 25 años de edad, quienes le ayudan a realizar sus labores agrícolas.- Actualmente, está casado y su esposa es su mano derecha con los quehaceres del hogar y cuido de sus hijos.

Marcos, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, a 1 kilómetros de su casa sembrara 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y en agosto siembra otra vez 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, para luego tener las dos cosechas en noviembre y diciembre, de esa forma tendrá para alimentar a su familia y además podrá vender un poco para otros gastos. 

Marcos, necesita el crédito para comprar 4 quintales de urea, 3 quintales de sulfato y una caneca de gramoxone, para fertilizar y limpiar el maíz en su primera y segunda etapa, la idea es darle todas las condiciones al cultivo para mejorar su rendimiento. 

Marcos, quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos, ya que son la principal fuente de alimentación de sus familia.
texts.en:
Marcos, 56 years old, is very hard-working. He lives with his 3 children, ages 7, 15, and 25, who help him do the agricultural work. He is married and his wife is his right hand with the household chores and care of their children. 

Marcos has worked in agriculture since he was very young. One kilometer from his house, he will plant 7,000 square meters of corn, and in August he will again plant 7,000 square meters of beans to then have the two harvests in November and December. In this way, he will have food for his family and also will be able to sell somet for other expenses. step
Marcos needs the loan to purchase 4 quintals [approximately 400 pounds] of urea, 3 quintals [approximately 300 pounds] of sulfate and a container [approximately 5 gallons] of Gramoxone to fertilize and clean the corn in its first and second stage; the plan is to give the crop all the conditions to improve its performance.

Marcos wants to continue growing basic grains since it is the primary source of food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 quintals [approximately 400 pounds] of urea, 3 quintals [approximately 300 pounds] of sulfate and a container [approximately 5 gallons] of Gramoxone, to fertilize and clean the corn.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
José, de 41 años de edad, está acompañado y vive con sus 2 hijos de 6, 14 y 20 años de edad, dos le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado totalmente a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad, trabajaba al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseño a cultivar la tierra, aparte de cultivar la tierra, sabe trabajar de albañil y eso le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos, para poder darle una buena alimentación a su familia. 

José, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo.- El año pasado le fue muy bien y espera que este año sea igual o mejor. 

José, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria, para que tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
José, 41 years old, is partnered and lives with his three children, ages 6, 14, and 20; two help him work in the cornfield, and his life partner takes care of the household tasks.

José is a very responsible man and completely dedicated to his family. He has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old. He worked at his father's side, who was the one who taught him to cultivate the land. Aside from cultivating the land, he knows how to work as a bricklayer, and this helps him to increase his income, to be able to provide his family with good nutrition.

José needs the loan to purchase manure, pesticides and fertilizers to plant 14,000 square meters of corn, 7,000 square meters of beans, and 7,000 square meters of sorghum. Last year it went very well for him and he hopes that this year will be equal or better. 

José dreams of seeing his children graduate with a university degree, so that they have better opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Noavisoa Tolojanahary

texts.fr:
Noavisoa Tolojanahary est une femme très dynamique et travailleuse de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et son époux travaille comme plombier. Ils ont un enfant de 4 ans et qui suit ses études en pré- scolaires dans une école privée actuellement. Tous les trois vivent ensemble dans une maison encore en location et elle envisage et projette de construire un jour sa propre maison.
Depuis 5 ans et jusqu'à maintenant, Noavisoa tient un magasin de quincaillerie, elle avait démarré avec un emprunt effectué auprès d'un membre de sa famille. Elle avait choisi le quincaillerie car elle pensait que c'est complémentaire avec le travail de son mari.
Son désire est d'étendre et développer son magasin: renouveler, augmenter et diversifier les stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter par conséquent les bénéfices.
texts.en:
Noavisoa Tolojanahary is a very dynamic and hard-working woman of 29. She is married and her husband is a plumber. They have a four-year old child who attends a private pre-school institution. The three of them live in rented accommodation at present and she is planning a project to build their own house one day.
For five years Noavisoa has run a hardware store. She started this business with a loan that she took from a member of her family.
She chose hardware because she thought that it would be complementary to her husband's profession.
She would like to expand her business: renew, increase, and diversify the stock of merchandise in order to increase the profits.

loans.use: to buy different pipes and articles for plumbing, sheet metal, and ciment.

loans.name: Ma. Lisa

texts.en:
Ma. Lisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lisa is 39 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Lisa has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Ma. Lisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве Жылдызкан на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 17,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья овец. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также хочет накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is very grateful to the Kiev Fund and to everyone who helped with the financing. Today Jyldyzkan has two cows and ten sheep. Her monthly profit is 17,500 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Jyldyzkan has once more applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to increase her herd of sheep. Jyldyzkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock, and also wants to save up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Umucyo Group

texts.en:
UMUCYO is a group led by Petronille, who is 45 years old. The group name means “right” in English. 

Petronille is married with five children aged between 11 and 27 years. She sells foodstuff and has been doing this in a business for the past seven years. 

The group members sell different items, and they have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, Petronille would like to buy more maize, coffee and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize, coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 30 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Жазгул среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается животноводством, начав бизнес в 2005 году. На данный момент в бизнесе Жазгул имеется 4 коровы и 20 овец, 2 лошади. Хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит увеличить доходы семьи.
texts.en: Zhazgul is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Zhazgul has a secondary education, and she rears animals as the main source of income for her family, having started her business in 2005. At the moment Zhazgul's business has four cows, twenty sheep, and two horses. The farm now brings in about 17,000 som (KGS) per month. Zhazgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening up and resale. Zhazgul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing the size of her herd, which will enable her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Daniel Alfonso

texts.es:
La casa de Daniel está llena de electrodomésticos, radios, televisores, teléfonos, lámparas, entre otros equipos que sus clientes le confían para que repare en su taller. Este técnico electrónico de 33 años de edad inició con su negocio desde hace diez años, cuando decidió emprender en un trabajo donde el fuera su propio jefe y que le permitiera estar más cerca de su familia. 
Con los años Daniel ha creado todo un equipo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y de sus tres hijos de cuatro, ocho y diez años de edad que con alegría van todos los días al colegio, gracias a este esfuerzo. Las expectativas de este emprendedor son ampliar su negocio, pero para cumplir con este propósito solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos de electrónicos y así tener materiales de calidad para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Con esto sus clientes incrementaran y podrá ahorrar para cumplir con su sueño. En sus planes también está terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Daniel's house is full of household appliances, radios, televisions, telephones, lamps, and other items that his customers trust him to repair in his shop. This electronics technician, 33 years old, began his business 10 years ago when he decided to undertake a job where he was his own boss and that permitted him to be closer to his family.

Over the years, Daniel has made a team that has helped him to get ahead and improve the quality of life of his wife and their three children, ages 4, 8 and 10, who happily go to school every day, thanks to his efforts. This entrepreneur's expectation is to expand his business, but to achieve this goal, he asks for a loan to purchase electronic repair parts and in this way have quality materials to offer a better service. With this, his customers will increase and he will be able to save up to achieve his dream. In his plans is also finishing his house.

loans.use: to purchase electronic parts.

loans.name: Djiguignouma V Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA  V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   TENINCOURA   ,  1 ère personne debout de la  droite vers   la gauche  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguignouma V group are married women who are on average 43 years old with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural affairs during the winter.
This is their seventh rural loan with the institution, the previous loans were repaid correctly.
Tenincoura, who is the first person standing on the right in the photo, grows groundnut.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds, and to pay labour costs for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
She sells her products in the village after harvest, to a clientele made up of resale agents and consumers.
She hopes to make an average profit of 125.000FCFA per field,
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs, to buy products for the earth, and seeds.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA  VI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   BINTOU   ,  1 ère personne assise de la   gauche vers   la   droite de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguignouma V1 group are married women who are on average 41 years old with three children and who all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural affairs during the winter.
This is their seventh rural loan with the institution, the previous loans were repaid correctly.
Bintou, who is the first person sitting on the left in the photo, grows groundnut.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds, and to pay for labour for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares.
She sells her products in the village after harvest, to a clientele made up of resale agents and consumers.
She hopes to make an average  profit of  100.000FCFA per field,
This profit would enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour, to buy products for the earth, and seeds.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don Salvador de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace más de 26 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus vetas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Salvador, 59 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a house he owns. He works in agriculture and has planted corn and beans for more than 26 years. He sells his products in the areas near where he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, etc., all in bulk, to continue with his work and, in this way, have more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de frazadas y edredones para dormitorio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, optimista, de buena actitud,  responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘urbanización mariscal Santa Cruz’, situada al norte de la ciudad habitada por migrantes aymarás provenientes del campo que se dedican al comercio y mano de obra. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Elizabeth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo color castaño, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de productos naturales para la salud, cambio de rubro y actualmente vende frazadas y edredones, productos muy comerciales debido al frío del lugar, “siempre vendí ambulantemente, ahora vendo en la feria de las mañaneras por mayor...” comenta. La feria de las mañaneras comienza a las 5 de la madrugada y se caracteriza por ventas por mayor a menores precios. La ventaja de su negocio es que debido al frio del lugar las ventas son contantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para realizar compras por mayor. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de frazadas y edredones por mayor para ofertar en la temporada de invierno. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de frazadas y edredones por mayor para mejorar sus ventas y estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43-year-old woman, single, has a 12-year-old daughter, and her business is selling blankets and bedspreads for the bedroom. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, optimistic, with a good attitude, and is responsible and very hard-working. She does her work in the ‘urbanización mariscal Santa Cruz’ area, located to the north of the city and inhabited by Aymará migrants coming from the countryside who work in trade and as laborers. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Elizabeth has dark skin, dark eyes, long brown hair, is of average height, average build, her native language is Aymará, which is spoken in that area, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her daughter who goes to school. They live in a house she owns, made of adobe, brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wooden floor, which has drinking water, electricity and sewer service. Previously, she worked selling natural health products; she changed her field and currently sells blankets and bedspreads, very sell-able products due to the cold in the area. "I always sold as a street vendor, now I sell at the early morning fair in bulk..." she says. The early morning fair begins at 5 in the morning and is characterized by bulk sales at better prices. The advantage of her business is that due to the cold in the area, the sales are constant. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to make her purchases in bulk. Her dream is to stabilize her business. She wants to purchase blankets and bedspreads in bulk to offer during the winter. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Elizabeth asks for a loan to purchase blankets and bedspreads in bulk to improve her sales and stabilize her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and bedspreads in bulk to improve her sales and stabilize her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: Mary  Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a raising-livestock business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Josephine is borrowing 13,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock for her raising-livestock business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей детскими вещами. Стартовав в 2010 году, благодаря упорному труду Асель, в обороте есть товар на сумму 250,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет до 14,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асель обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку детских вещей для расширения ассортимент в магазине. Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее дела и хочет накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Asel is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. She has a higher education, and she sells children's clothes as the main source of income for her family. Having started in 2010, thanks to Asel's hard work she has a stock of goods worth 250,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is up to 14,700 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Asel has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy children's clothes to increase the product range in her shop. Asel plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business and wants to save up to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for retail sale in order to increase the product range in her shop.

loans.name: Gulshat

texts.ru: Гулшат, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гулшат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 4 коровы, 30 овец. Также на 1,0 Га земли она выращивает арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). Гулшат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота. Гулшат намерена развивать свой бизнес, увеличивая тем самым ее доходы, что позволит накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Gulshat is 45 years old, married, and together with her husband she is raising four children. She has a secondary education, and she rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family, having started 25 years ago. Thanks to Gulshat's perseverance, dedication and hard work today she has four cows and thirty sheep. She also grows watermelon for sale on 1.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income is about 22,000 som (KGS). Gulshat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Gulshat intends to develop her business, and in doing so to increase her income, which will enable her to save up for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 28, is married and has three children aged between 1 and 7 years. One of them goes to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 11 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, 47, is married and has seven children aged between 3 and 20 years. Four of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 27 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и садоводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Кызжибек, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров, 5 лошадей, 50 овец. На участке выращивает орехи и сливы для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 10,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кызжибек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Kyzzhibek is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family, having started 20 years ago. Thanks to Kyzzhibek's hard work, today she has eight cows, five horses, and fifty sheep. She grows nuts and plums for sale on a plot of land. Her monthly income is about 10,500 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Kyzzhibek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep to increase the size of her herd. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock which will enable her to improve the well-being of her family and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie, 43, is married and has five children aged between 7 and 20 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past six years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Marie Beatrice

texts.en:
Marie Beatrice, 33, is married and has four children aged between 4 and 12 years. Three of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past five years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Gulparis

texts.ru: Гулпарис, 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. С 1994 года занимается животноводством и полеводством и полеводством. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. В хозяйстве Гулпарис есть 2 коровы, 8 овец, лошадь. Также земельный надел мерою 2,15 ГА, где она выращивает картофель, кукурузу, клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулпарис составляет 12,000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом(KGS) на покупку телят и ягнят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулпарис направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulparis is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops since 1994. Her family actively help her on the farm. Gulparis has two cows, eight sheep, and a horse. She also has a 2.15 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes, corn, and clover. Gulparis's monthly profit is 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further increase the size of her herd, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and lambs for fattening up and resale. Gulparis will direct the proceeds of the loan to further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and lambs for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
Fortune, 46, is married and has four children aged between 9 and 21 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare, to pay school fees of her children, and to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 43 years old. She is married and has six children aged between 8 and 21 years. Three of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years.  Also her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sèbèkè Group

texts.fr:
L’homme qui tient la daba sur l’épaule est Dory sur la photo.
Agé de 38 ans Dory est agriculteur vivant dans une commune rurale au Mali avec son épouse ménagère et ses 7 enfants, dont 5 scolarisé ; ils sont âgés de 6 à 15 ans. 
  Dory  achète les bœufs de labours et intrants agricoles pour  cultiver son champs d’arachide.Il s’approvisionne au marché local et fait sa vente au comptant et à crédit au grand marché. Il exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans, il souhaitera assurer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille surtout à l’éducation, la santé et nourriture suffisante pour les enfants. Il est analphabète et se sert des revenus de ses champs d’arachide pour prendre ses propres besoins et de ses enfants. Le souhait de développer son activité lui pousse à contracter le prêt auprès du RMCR. La sécheresse joue souvent beaucoup sur les cultures pendant l’hivernage.
texts.en:
Dory is the man in the photo with an axe on his shoulder.
He is 38 and he is a farmer who lives in a rural commune in Mali with his wife who is a housewife, and his seven children. Five of them attend school: they are between six and fifteen years of age.
Dory buys working bullocks and agricultural products to cultivate his field of groundnuts. He buys his supplies at the local market and sells his products retail for cash or credit at the big market. He has been in this business for four years. He would like to improve living conditions for his family, especially their education and health care, and he would like to have sufficient food for his children. He is illiterate and uses his income from his groundnut fields to provide for himself and his children. His wish to develop his business pushed him towards contracting a loan from RMCR. Drought is often a big problem for his crops during the winter.

loans.use: to buy bullocks and products for the earth to cultivate his field.

loans.name: Morlita

texts.en:
Morlita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She has a buy and sell native products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more native bags to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Morlita dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy more native bags to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for 5 years. Lilia earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Milagros has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 69 years old and married with two children. 

Lilia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilia has been in pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She earns additional income from a general store.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 46 years old and has six children. Norma is a married woman.

Norma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Norma has been in this business for 5 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Everienne

texts.en:
Everienne is 47 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 9 and 28 years, 5 of whome go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years, while her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for her maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for her maize crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Bolotbek

texts.ru: Болотбек, 63 года, женат, 3 детей. Болотбек на пенсии, у него высшее образование и многолетний стаж. На сегодняшний день, в качестве дохода для своей семьи Болотбек занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 49 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день он имеет: 3 коров, 6 овец. На участке мерою 4,0 Га он выращивает фасоль и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для посева ячменя, после сбора Болотбек направит его в качестве корма для скота. Болотбек намерен получить хороший урожай, что позволит увеличить поголовье скота и накопить на проведение отопления в доме.
texts.en: Bolotbek is 63 years old, married, and has three children. Bolotbek is retired. He has a higher education and many years of work experience. Today, Bolotbek grows crops and rears income to get income for his family, having started 49 years ago. Thanks to his hard work, today he has three cows and six sheep. He grows beans and clover for sale on a 4.0 hectare plot of land. His monthly income is 8,800 som (KGS). In order to further develop his farm, he has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to sow barley. After harvesting it, Bolotbek will use it as livestock feed. Bolotbek intends to get a good harvest, which will allow him to increase the size of his herd and save up to install heating in his house.

loans.use: to sow barley for livestock feed so he can save money towards installing a heating system in his house.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 44 years old. He is married and has four children between 6 and 14 years old. They all go to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past seven years. His wife is a businesswoman. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Nasipahan

texts.ru: Насипахан, 28 лет, замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, 2 года занимается ручным пошивом и торговлей национальной одежды и одежных принадлежностей. Работает в основном под заказ, но также закупает товар под реализацию. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 9,500 сом (KGS). Насипахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку национальной одежды и аксессуаров для продажи. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Насипахан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее дела.
texts.en: Nasipahan is 28 years old, married, and has no children. She has a higher education. For two years she has been hand-sewing and selling national clothing and clothing accessories. She works mostly to order, but also buys in goods for resale. Her monthly profit is 9,500 som (KGS). Nasipahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy national clothing and accessories for sale. Nasipahan plans to invest the proceeds from running her business in the further development of her activities.

loans.use: to buy national clothing and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Kholmoh

texts.ru: Это Холмох. Ей 40лет. Она жительница района Чиликул. Холмох замужем и мать четверых детей. У нее 2 дочери и 2 сыновья. Ее муж уже много лет находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Холмох каждый месяц ждет, когда ее муж отправить ей деньги, она не стала ждать его денежных средств и начала открыть свой бизнес. Сейчас Холмох занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она ухаживает за детьми, ведет домашнее хозяйство и одновременно занимается выращиванием скота. Холмох на все успевает. Она одна ухаживает о домашних животных, ей тяжело, но она старается. Сейчас Холмох хочет купить скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и не потерять источник дохода. У нее нет денег для купли скота, и она решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Kholmoh. She is 40 years old. She is a resident of Jilikul District. Kholmoh is married and the mother of four children. She has two daughters and two sons. Her husband has been away working in the Russian Federation for many years in order to earn money and provide for the family. Kholmoh would wait for her husband to send her money each month, but then she stopped waiting for his funds and began opening her own business. Now Kholmoh is engaged in agricultural activities. She looks after the children, runs the household, and simultaneously rears animals. Kholmoh manages to do everything. She looks after the domestic livestock alone. It is difficult for her, but she tries. Now Kholmoh wants to buy livestock in order to develop further and not lose a source of income. She has no money to buy livestock, and she has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль, 48 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи уже 7 лет занимается торговлей продуктами питания (овощами и фруктами). Есть товар в обороте на сумму 300,000 сом (KGS). Нургуль решила развить свою деятельность и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита позволят ей улучшить благосостояние и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Nurgul is 48 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education. Her neighbors speak very well of her. For the last seven years she has been selling food products (fruits and vegetables) as the main source of income for her family. She has 300,000 som (KGS) of goods in stock. Nurgul has decided to develop her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase her stock of goods. The proceeds of the loan will enable her to improve her well-being and further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy produce for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 56 years old and is married with six children. Four of her children are still in school. For the past five years, Loreta has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has borrowed six previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Loreta is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila is 57 years old and is married with two children. One of her children is in school. For the past 10 years, Panfila has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. She has borrowed seven previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Panfila is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Intwari Group

texts.en: Daphrose is a group leader, aged 53. She is married with 3 children aged between 25 and 30 years; all of them go to school. The group is called Intwali, which means “Heroes” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for a better future. She owns a restaurant and has been doing this business for the past 31 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, meat and Irish potatoes in order to make more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, meat and Irish potatoes in order to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 10 and 21 years, they all go to school. She sells stones for construction and she has been in a business for 8 years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more stones for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings. In the future, she wishes to earns at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more stones for resale.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 14 years. She owns a mini market and she has been in this business for the past 4 years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy cakes and breads for resale. The profits from the business will used to buy a piece of land. In the future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month

loans.use: to buy cakes and breads for resale.

loans.name: Twisungane Need Photo Group

texts.en:
Twisungane Need is a group led by Jeanne who is 37 years old. The group name means “Join each other” in English. 

Jeanne is married with 2 children aged 2 and 6 years. She has a shop and has been doing business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Jeanne would like to buy more rice, beans, soap and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en: Felecite is a group leader, aged 28. She is married with two children aged 4 and 7 years. They both go to school. The group is called Twisungane which means “Support each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for a better future. Felecite is a tailor and has been doing this business for the past 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: Ubumwe B Group

texts.en: Ubumwe is a group led by Speciose who is 35 years old. The group name means “Unity” in English. Speciose has been a group leader for 4 years. She owns a shop and has been selling as a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Abahujumugambi Group

texts.en: Abahujumugambi is a group led by Vestine who is 43 years old. The group name means “Same mission” in English. Vestine is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 21 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 7 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Vestine would like to buy more sorghum and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and maize to sell.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ, 38 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 18 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки скота на сумму 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она имеет достаточно большой и прибыльный бизнес, у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, также имеется 0,29 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, на которой Гулназ выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулназ обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для отгона на пастбище и откорма с целью последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять на развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulnaz is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. For 18 years she has been growing crops and rearing animals, having started this business with the purchase of livestock costing 3,000 som (KGS). Now she has a sufficiently large and profitable business. She has two cows and ten sheep, and she also has 0.29 hectares of her own land and 1.0 hectares of rented land on which Gulnaz grows barley for sale. In order to further develop her farm, Gulnaz has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for free-range pasture and fattening with the aim of subsequently reselling them. She plans to direct the proceeds of the loan to developing her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening in the field and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Group

texts.en: Monique is a group leader, aged 44. She is married with 8 children aged between 2 and 19 years. They all go to school. The group is called Twibumbirehamwe means “Altogether” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for a better future. Monique owns a shop and has been doing business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru:
30 летный мужчина Салим из района Чиликул. Он родился и вырос в родном районе. В районах и селах Таджикистана отличная погода для сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Салим  на родном  районе занимается растениеводством. Все жители района занимается земледелием и животноводством. Салим параллельно занимается животноводством. И свободное время он занимается перевозом товаров на своем Мотороле.  Салим не может сидеть без дел, он всегда трудится. 
Салим женат и отец двоих детей. Детям 8 и 5 лет. Он любить свою семью и для них он всегда готов сделать все. Салим посадил урожай, и ему надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Но их у него нет, для купли нет денег. По этой причине Салим обратился к Вам за кредитом.  Вы можете поддержать его!
texts.en:
This 30-year-old man is Salim from the Jilikul district. He was born and raised in his native district. Tajikistan's regions and villages have excellent weather for agricultural activities. Salim grows crops in his local area. All of the residents of the area grow crops and rear animals. Salim rears animals in parallel, and in his spare time he transports goods on his scooter. Salim cannot sit idle -- he is always working.

Salim is married and the father of two children. His children and eight and five years old. He loves his family and is always ready to do anything for them. Salim has planted crops, and he needs to cultivate them with mineral fertilizer. But he does not have fertilizer, and he has no money to buy it. For this reason Salim has turned to you for a loan. You can support him!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don Jose de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su madre en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Mr. Jose is 50 years old. For the past 20 years he has worked in agriculture, he grows corn and vegetables. He sells his products in the different markets found close to his house. He lives with his mother in his own house. Jose is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague controls, etc. and to improve the land he shows in the picture,  to continue with his work and to improve his earnings.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, plague control, and to improve the lot.

loans.name: Guli

texts.ru: Гули общительная, самостоятельная  и добрая девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Гули учится четвертым курсе в университете, и она работает учительницей в средней школе. Свободное время она во дворе занимается растениеводством. Гули на все успевает. На районе Чиликул она живет вместе отцом, матерью и братьями. В течении 9 лет она постоянная сажает урожай.  Гули готовила землю к новому посеву урожай. В этом году Гули хочет сажать картофель и лук. Она на заемные деньги хочет купить семена картофель, лук и минеральные удобрения. И активна готовится к посеву. У нее не получилось собрать достаточную сумму денег для приобретения средств для посева и у нее вся надежда остается на кредит.
texts.en: Guli is a sociable, independent and kind girl. She is 26 years old. She is unmarried and has no children. Guli is studying her fourth year at university, and she works as a secondary school teacher. She grows crops in her yard during her spare time. Guli manages to do everything. She lives in Jilikul district with her father, mother and brothers. She has been planting crops constantly for the last nine years. Guli has prepared the ground for sowing a new crop. This year she wants to plant potatoes and onions. She wants to buy potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizer with the borrowed money. She is actively preparing for the sowing. She was not able to gather enough money to buy the things she needs for sowing and all of her hopes rest on a loan.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mylene works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food. Mylene has been sustaining her business activities with her three previous loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her prior loans.

Mylene is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell at her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and married with five children. For the past ten years, she has been a root-crop and vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Lorna earns additional income from selling food. 

Lorna is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Бибисоро 41 летняя женщина. Она проживает на районе Чиликул вместе сыновьям и дочерями. Муж Бибиоро находится на заработках загранице. Бибиморо живет вместе детьми. Она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Этим она занимается уже много лет. Ее основная работа является животноводством. Потому, что доход от животноводство обеспечить ее семью. Земледелие для себя. Сейчас Бибисоро решила увеличить поголовье скота, чтобы сохранить деятельность и зарабатывать по больше. По этой причине она обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en: Bibisoro is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in the Jilikul district together with her sons and daughters. Bibisoro's husband is away earning money abroad. Bibisoso grows crops and rears animals. She has been doing this for many years. Her main work is rearing animals because the income from rearing animals provides for her family. She grows crops for herself. Now Bibisoro has decided to increase the size of her herd in order to preserve the business and earn more money. For this reason she has turned to you for a loan.

loans.use: to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Простой мужчина из района Чиликул это Абдугафор. Он женатый мужчина, и живет вместе отцом и матерью. Абдугафор занимается таксистом. У него уже есть опыт работы. Он начал свой бизнес 3 года назад. Абдугафор долго не смог найти работу и решил купить машину и начать предоставлять услуги таксиста. Сейчас у Абдугафор сломался машина, и он данный момент без работы. Ему надо починить автомашину, чтобы продвигать работу. Абдугафор очень надеется на кредит, чтобы купить автозапчасти и восстановить автомашин.
texts.en: Abdugafor is a simple man from the Jilikul district. He is a married man, and lives with his father and mother. Abdugafor works as a taxi driver. He already has experience in this work. He started his business three years ago. Abdugafor was not able to find a job for a long time and decided to buy a car and start offering a taxi service. Now Abdugafor's car has broken down, and at the moment he is without work. He needs to repair her car in order to continue working. Abdugafor hopes very much for a loan to buy spare parts and restore his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Lotche

texts.en:
Lotche is married and runs a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past ten years and she works hard to support her family.

Lotche is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Reza

texts.en:
Reza is a 24-year-old woman with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past four years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. Reza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Reza is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She is a rice farmer in the Philippines and also earns an income from raising pigs. Editha successfully repaid her previous loan.

Editha is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Lucenda

texts.en:
Lucenda is married and runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has run her business for 15 years and she works hard to support her family. 

Lucenda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She runs a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. Ponciana successfully repaid her previous loan.

Ponciana is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more lumber to sell. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy lumber to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old and married with six children. For the past three years, she has been raising livestock and she also earns additional income from running a general store.

Lucia is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Iskra

texts.ru: Искра, 38 лет, замужем. У них с мужем 3 детей. Искра в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2010 году начала заниматься торговлей одеждой, преимущественно нижним бельем. Благодаря упорному труду в ее бизнесе на сегодняшний день имеется товар в обороте на сумму 62,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Искра обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на пополнение оборотных средств за счет покупки товара. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и в образование ее детей.
texts.en: Iskra is 38 and married. She and her husband have three children. Iskra began selling clothing, mostly underwear, in 2010 to earn income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, her business currently has 62,000 som (KGS) in inventory.
