In order to expand her business, Iskra applied for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to acquire working capital to purchase more goods. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the development of her business and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a creative woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an emigrant.

For almost three years she has been a farmer. She is a well known client at IMON and has a trusted loan history. She is a responsible, goal oriented and honest person. With the money that she previously borrowed from IMON she built a house to live in. Recently, in order to finish construction of her house and live in it, she appealed to IMON asking for financial support. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and IMON.

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to finish construction of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a greenhouse for farming to improve production.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира, 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Эльмиры среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже много лет, Эльмира занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 13 коров, 27 овец. На участке мерою 2,40 ГА она выращивает клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira is 58 and married with two children. She has a secondary education. Though finding work in the village is very difficult, one has to support one's family and care for one's children, therefore she has been working in agriculture for many years. She currently has 13 cows and 27 sheep on her farm as well as 2.4 hectares of land where she grows clover for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Elmira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further increasing her quantity of animals and toward home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en:
Romelie is 43 years old with three children. Romelie works very hard to provide for them.

Romelie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, home product care items and other groceries.

Romelie has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Romelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, home product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 41 years old and married with two children. Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marife has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, noodles, bread, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Marife would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sarah Mie

texts.en:
Sarah Mie is a woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sarah Mie is 29 years old and has five children who are in school.

Sarah Mie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sarah Mie requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Sarah Mie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Sarah Mie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 24 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Conchita dreams that, one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janllesa

texts.en:
Janllesa works hard to support her family. Janllesa is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Janllesa has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Janllesa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years. Evangeline earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Leonida dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Theurn's Group

texts.en: Theurn, 52, is a mother of six dependent children. Only two of them are in school. She lives in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland and works on another farm for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for more than five years and it earns her about 51,400 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a labor fee. She hopes to earn more income and have the ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a labor fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 39 years old and has two children. Melodina is married and has two children who are in school.

Melodina is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Melodina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Melodina has been buying and selling livestock for 3 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melodina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Salminio

texts.en: Salminio makes good earning on his farm in Oroquieta. This is the primary means of his income, supporting their needs. He wants to increase his farm yield, Salminio approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase fertilizer and compost for the vegetables, corn, and root crops that he grows on his newly built nursery. He has high hopes that he will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for the vegetables, corn, and root crops that he grows on his farm

loans.name: Diocefe

texts.en:
Diocefe is from Pagadian City.  She is 53 years old, a widow with six children. She renders her time in farming activities where she generates income to support her family. She has been in her business for 10 years. 

Diocefe is a member of PMPC where she availed an amount of Php 5,000.00 to buy fertilizers. Diocefe is indeed thankful for the help.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivencia is 49 years old.

Vivencia has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more root crops to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vivencia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Vivencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rootcrops to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy  is a married woman with eight children, none of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a rental house business for the past seven years, renting houses to the people at the community. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase construction materials to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru: Санобархон, 58 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 22 года назад, благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Санобархон, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы. На 0,45 Га она выращивает лук для реализации, а также органические саженцы абрикосовых, персиковых, сливовых деревьев. Санобархон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для закупки саженцев для их выращивания и перепродажи. Санобархон намерена развивать свой бизнес, увеличивая тем самым ее доходы.
texts.en: Sanobarhon is 58, widowed, and a mother of two. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she started doing 22 years ago. Thanks to her tenacity, dedication, and hard work, she currently has two cows. She grows onions to sell on a 0.45 hectare plot of land, as well as organic seedings of apricot, peach, and plum trees. Sanobarhon applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy seedings to grow and resell. Sanobarhon intends to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fruit tree seedlings to grow and resell

loans.name: Pascalina

texts.en:
Pascalina is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She mentioned  transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 63 years old, married with four children.

Perla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Perla has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs .

Perla aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old, married with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Adulia

texts.en:
Adulia works hard to support her family. Adulia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Adulia requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Adulia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Adulia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 30 years old. He is not married. He sells material construction material and has been doing this business for the past 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy iron sheets, nails and cement for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets, nails and cement for selling

loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants:groupement "takku Liggey"

texts.fr:
Le groupement « épouses des enseignants, Takku Ligguey » regroupe cinq femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce et qui logent dans le même quartier. 
Mariama est la présidente, âgée de 40 ans, elle évolue dans le commerce depuis dix ans. Elle vend des tissus et de l’aliment volaille. Le crédit lui permettra  d’honorer  une commande de tissus et de renforcer son stock d’aliments poussins. Mariama  est mariée et mère de famille, elle n’a pas de charges sinon ses besoins personnels.
Elle a comme ambition de faire de l’aviculture à grande échelle.
texts.en:
The group named "Epouses des enseignants, Takku Liggey" is made up of five woman who work in commerce and live in the same area. Mariama is the president of this group. She is 40 years old and has worked in commerce for ten years. She sells fabric and poultry feed. 

This loan will allow her to honor an order for fabric and to increase her stock of chicken feed.

Mariama is married and a mother of a family. She does not have any expenses except for her own personal needs. 

Her goal is to start a large-scale poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy fabric and poultry feed

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 44 years old and married with three children.

She runs an agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Roselyn has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Roxanne works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising.  Roxanne is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to  purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Roxanne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gertrudes works hard to support her family.

She has a personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Gertrudes is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like perfume, body-lotion, shampoo and other beauty products to sell.

Gertrudes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body-lotion, shampoo and other beauty products

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 60 years old, married with three children.

Tessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and etc.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Tessie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Aloura

texts.en:
Aloura is 26 years old and married with two children.  

Aloura is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Aloura requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Aloura has been buying and selling livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Aloura would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married four children and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice and general store.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mario Domingo

texts.es:
El olor a cuero se siente al acercarse al negocio de Mario, un hombre de 58 años de edad, con más 40 años de experiencia en zapatería, pues desde pequeño miró y ayudó a su padre en el mismo trabajo. Esto sirvió para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus cuatro hijos, que ahora son independientes, y de su esposa, que siempre lo ha apoyado. 
Siendo los zapatos algo indispensable en la vida de las personas, Mario se siente orgulloso de ser zapatero. Por esto, invertir en su negocio es importante para ofrecer un buen servicio. De manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar hilo, pega, cuero, agujas, entre otros materiales. Esto le permitirá incrementar sus clientes y por ende sus ingresos para cumplir con su plan de mejorar su local.
texts.en:
The smell of leather hits you as you approach Mario's business. He is 58 years old and has more than 40 years experience in shoe making. When he was young he watched and helped his father in the same business.  This helped him to improve the quality of life of his four children, who are now independent, and his wife who has always supported him.

As shoes are an indispensable item in people's lives, Mario feels proud to be a cobbler.  

It is therefore important to invest in his business in order to offer a good service. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy, thread, glue, leather, needles as well as other materials. 

This will allow him to increase his clients, and consequently income, which means he can carry out his plan to improve his store.

loans.use: to buy, thread, glue, leather, needles as well as other materials.

loans.name: Kotonyontala Group

texts.fr:
La dame qui est en position de cultiver avec la daba au bout sur la photo est M’péné.
Agée de 40 ans, M’Pènè est une femme mariée vivante  dans une  commune rurale au Mali, avec son époux cultivateur et ses 5 enfants qui ne sont pas à l’école.
L’activité agricole de M’Pènè consiste à acheter la semence et autres intrants agricole pour cultiver un champ d’arachide. L’ambition de M’Pènè tourne autour de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants, en santé, nourriture suffisante et habillement.
 Elle s’approvisionne sur le grand  marché de sa commune et écoule  ses produits au même marché communal.
Cette activité qu’elle exerce depuis 5 ans et qu’elle ambitionne de développer lui motive à faire recourt au prêt RMCR qu’elle trouve très avantageux. Elle est analphabète et se sert des profits de champs d’arachide  pour assurer le bien-être de ses enfants et aussi répondre à ses propres besoins. Le non abondance de pluie joue beaucoup sur la production des cultures d’arachides.
texts.en:
The woman who is holding an adz and is in the position of a farmer in the photo is named M'Pene. She is 40 years old, married, and lives in a rural area in Mali. She cannot read or write. She lives with her husband, who is also a farmer, and their five children. None of the children go to school.

M'Pene's farming involves buying seeds and other farm inputs for growing groundnuts. She procures her supplies from the grand market and also sells her crops there. A lack of rain greatly affects the farming of groundnuts.

She has been farming for five years and hopes to develop her work. It is for this reason she joined RMCR, where she now finds many advantages.

Earnings from her groundnut farming ensures the well-being of her children and also supports their needs. Her goal is to improve the living condition of her children related to their health, food, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 45 years old and a mother of three children who are all in school. They live in Kampong Cham province. To overcome her family’s hardship, she has been growing rice on three hectares of farmland for 27 years   She also does tailoring of clothes for a fee. She could earn about 54,000KHR per day to support her family's needs. 

This is her first loan cycle for her group, which contain of five members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Arfen Jescil

texts.en:
Arfen Jescil is 23 years old. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Arfen Jescil is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arfen Jescil has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like personal products retail business.

Marilou dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlin is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to help raise her livestock.

Arlin has been raising livestock for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to help raise her livestock

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Wilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Nena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nena has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 50 years old and has eight children. Carmelita is married and has two children who are still in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Carmelita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and has five children. Gloria is married and has three children who are still in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gloria has been in pig fattening for 5 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Florivic

texts.en:
Florivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines and she is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Florivic dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation.

Emelyn has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising goats.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Nilda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Columba is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Columba has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Columba requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Columba has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Columba would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Henrieta

texts.en:
Henrieta works hard to support her family. Henrieta is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Henrieta requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Henrieta has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Henrieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Enriquita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, salt, etc. for her food production business.

Enriquita has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Enriquita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, salt, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hazel is 38 years old and both of her children are in school.

Hazel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Hazel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 50-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anita has a business buying and selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Anita has been in this business for 8 years. 

Anita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and fertilizer for her business.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and fertilizer for her business

loans.name: Holiniso

texts.en:
Holiniso is a careful mother. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an agrarian. 

Holiniso is a teacher of Russian language and has worked at a secondary school since 1995. She takes care of her children and wants to have well-educated children. 

This year Holiniso's son is going to enter university. She and her husband appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay their son's higher education costs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay her son's higher education costs

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La socia Juana Paula  se dedica al negocio de venta de flores y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas y margaritas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juana Paula  works selling flowers and she also works in the vegetable selling business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants to get her family ahead through her businesses. She is requesting the loan to buy roses and daisies. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy roses and daisies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and married and they're blessed with two children. 

She has owned a business selling fish in their village for almost eight years and she earns a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Her net income on this business was utilized in purchasing a new motorcycle to use in her fish vending. 

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to acquire a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase milk fish and St. Peter's fish (tilapia) to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase milk fish and St. Peter's fish (tilapia) to sell.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Tienta Tata a la main soulvée sur la photo.
 Malien âgé de 56 ans, Tienta Tata est  polygame et père de 8 enfants  dont 7 scolarisés.
Tienta Tata est agriculteur et éleveur dans sa localité.
Ses femmes sont ménagères et font la culture d’arachide et le petit jardinage pour subvenir à leur besoins.
Il fait recourt au R.M.C.R pour prendre de l’argent  pour  ses activités de champs.
Tienta Tata lit et écrit dans la langue nationale.
Le prêt ainsi reçu sera investi dans l’achat d’herbicide pour son champ d’arachide.
Ses activités consistent à cultiver de l’arachide pendant l’hivernage et à acheter des vaches maigres allaitantes et les mettre à l’embouche pendant la saison sèche.
Il espère ainsi pouvoir lutter contre la pauvreté et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire dans sa famille.
Tienta Tata affirme qu’il épargne un veau par ans comme bénéfice dans ses activités.
Il habite en milieu rural avec sa famille au Mali .
Il exerce ce métier depuis 30 ans et y attaché à cause du profit qu’il en tire.
Souvent il est confronté aux déficits pluviométriques et à la chute brutale du prix de l’arachide sur le marché.
texts.en:
Tienta Tata has his hand raised in the photo. From Mali and 56 years old, he has a polygamous household and is the father of eight children, of whom seven go to school. He himself can read and write in the national language. 

He is a farmer and raises livestock in his area, something he has done for 30 years because of the profits he can earn. In the rainy season, he grows groundnuts, and then in the dry season he buys slim, lactating cows and then fattens them. His wives do housework, garden, and grow groundnuts to support their needs.

Tienta Tata joined RMCR to fund his farming activities. This loan will be used to buy herbicide for his groundnut field. He hopes to be able to fight against poverty and ensure his family's food independence. 

Tienta Tata says that he saves one calf each year as a profit from his work. He lives in a rural area with his family in Mali. He often is confronted with rain shortages and falls in the price of groundnuts at the market.

loans.use: to buy herbicide

loans.name: Ningrum

texts.en:
Mrs. Ningrum has a family of three and lives in a town in Malang Regency, Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. 

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. 

Mrs. Ningrum heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling and without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Ningrum, who is also a leader of her neighbourhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 

This loan will allow Mrs. Ningrum to buy 40 filters to sell on consignment to her neighbours making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters to sell to her neighbours providing them with safe drinking water

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia Susana se dedica al negocio de venta de flores, la socia vende rosas, claveles entre otras flores, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas y claveles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Susana works in the flower selling business. She sells roses and carnations amongst other flowers. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants to get her family ahead through her business. She is requesting the loan to buy roses and carnations. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy roses and carnations.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as peanuts, butter, sugar, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for two years now.

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as peanuts, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica desde hace 40 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol también posee una pequeña tienda en su casa, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives in his own home with his wife and has worked in farming for 40 years growing corn and beans. 

He has a small shop in his house and during harvest season he sells his crops in surrounding villages where he has a lot of regular customers. 

He is applying for loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides. 

This will enable him to continue farming which is his only source of work and way of improving his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad,  quien habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 17 años de edad y un niño de 20 años de edad, desde hace 23 años.  María con mucho esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y a la vez ha venido haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda para hacerla un poco más segura,  ella  se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 3 años, además  cuenta con una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos básicos.  María desea construir un corredor es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tejas, laminas, polines, cemento, arena y mano de obra para la construcción del techo del corredor.
texts.en: María is 49 years old and has lived in her own house for 23 years with her life companion and her two daughters, one who is 17 and the other who is 20 years old. María through great effort has been able to get her family ahead and at the same time has been making improvements to her house to make it more secure. She has worked offering her domestic services for 3 years plus she has a small store where she offers basic products. María wants to construct a veranda so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in tiles, laminated sheeting, poles, cement, sand and pay for labor to construct the roof of her veranda.

loans.use: to invest in tiles, laminated sheeting, poles, cement, sand and pay for labor to construct the roof of her veranda.

loans.name: Qapaq Niño De Huaynapata - Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Qoya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es casada tiene 58 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, por su negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pltanos, naranjas entre otros.
Los  socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members belong to Qapaq Niño de Huaynapata--Coya Communal Bank, located in the Qoya district of the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.

The member Victoria is 58 years old and married and has 5 children. She works in her business selling fruit. She has worked in this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. Through her business, Victoria moves her children ahead, and she wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, oranges, and other fruits. The members of the group feel grateful for the loan, and promise to make the payments as established.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges and other fruit.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén de 45 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos económicos y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Él vive con sus cinco hijos, el desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo ya que dentro de poco empieza la época de siembra, para ello solicita un crédito para invertir en: semillas, fertilizante y abono para seguir con su cultivo con el que espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Rubén is 45 years old and since he was young he learned to work the land. He has worked growing corn and beans for 20 years. Doing this he has obtained better economic income and provided better living conditions for his family. He lives with his five children. He wants to invest in agricultural inputs for his crops as the planting season starts soon. So he is requesting a loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer and manure to continue with his growing. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia Violeta  se dedica al negocio de venta de flores, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas,claveles y margaritas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Violeta works in her flower selling business. She wants to get her family ahead through her business. Her dream is to expand her flower selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy roses, carnations and daisies. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her loan installments.

loans.use: to buy roses, daisies and carnations.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 60 years old and widowed with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening in the Philippines. Conchita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Paulina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Christiline

texts.en:
Christiline is married, 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Christiline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Christiline requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Christiline has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Christiline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs
